original: @327b / /rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @327b / /rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: shr'i badzra d'a ka n'a ma ma h'a tantra r'a dz'a /
analyzed: shr'i badzra d'a ka n'a ma ma h'a tantra r'a dz'a /
translated: Śrī-vajradāka-nāma-mahātantrarāja.

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes bya ba /
translated: The glorious great king of tantras called Vajradāka.

original: bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen po @328a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thugs rje chen po @328a *//
translated: Blessed One of great compassion,

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Avalokiteśvara.

original: mkha' 'gro kun dngos sems dpa' ni //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun dngos sems dpa' ni //
translated: The hero who is the embodiment of all ḍākinīs,

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog /🔽gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog / gsang ba mchog gi dgyes pa na //
translated: Vajradāka, the supreme bliss,🔽Always abides in the supreme secret's delight,

original: thams cad bdag nyid rtag tu bzhugs //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid rtag tu bzhugs //
translated: The nature of everything.

original: 'di ni rang byung bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: 'di ni rang byung bcom ldan 'das //
translated: This self-arisen Blessed One

original: lhag pa yi ni lha gcig nyid //
analyzed: lhag pa yi ni lha gcig nyid //
translated: Is the sole deity of the highest.

original: 'byung gnas sgra tshul nges 'byung rnams //
analyzed: 'byung gnas sgra tshul nges 'byung rnams //
translated: The sources, sounds, and definite emergences

original: dam tshig spyod pa'i spyod yul yin //
analyzed: dam tshig spyod pa'i spyod yul yin //
translated: Are the domain of conduct in the commitments.

original: 'jig rten gsum du rnyed dka' ba //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum du rnyed dka' ba //
translated: Difficult to find in the three worlds,

original: thog ma dbus mthar yang dag gnas //
analyzed: thog ma dbus mthar yang dag gnas //
translated: It abides in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: 'dod chags ma yin chags bral min //
analyzed: 'dod chags ma yin chags bral min //
translated: Not desire, not free from desire,

original: dbu mar yang ni mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dbu mar yang ni mi dmigs so //
translated: It is not observed in the middle.

original: bud med kun gyi sgyu ma'i rgya //
analyzed: bud med kun gyi sgyu ma'i rgya //
translated: The seal of illusion of all women,

original: 'di ni gnyis med ye shes mchog /
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis med ye shes mchog /
translated: This is the supreme nondual intuition,

original: rnyed dang bde ba kun mos pas //
analyzed: rnyed dang bde ba kun mos pas //
translated: Which is the source of all happiness.

original: ngan par spyod pa'ang 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: ngan par spyod pa'ang 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: Even evil conduct will be successful.

original: nam mkha' kun tu rgyu grub pas;/
analyzed: nam mkha' kun tu rgyu grub pas;/
translated: Because of the accomplishment of the movement in all space,

original: mkha' 'gro ma zhes rab tu grags //🔽sna tshogs kun tu phyag rgya ni //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma zhes rab tu grags // sna tshogs kun tu phyag rgya ni //
translated: It is well known as the dakini.🔽The seal of all varieties

original: sna tshogs kun gyi sdom pa yis //
analyzed: sna tshogs kun gyi sdom pa yis //
translated: Is the vow of all varieties.

original: mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: The union with all dakinis

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes byar grub //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes byar grub //
translated: Is established as the vajra dakini.

original: de nyid med sems rnal 'byor ba //
analyzed: de nyid med sems rnal 'byor ba //
translated: The yoga of the mind without reality🔽Is the visualization of the deity,

original: lha la dmigs par byed pa dang // kun tu gzugs brnyan yid kyis ni //
analyzed: lha la dmigs par byed pa dang // kun tu gzugs brnyan yid kyis ni //
translated: And the mental reflection on the image

original: lugs sogs rnal 'byor skye ba min //
analyzed: lugs sogs rnal 'byor skye ba min //
translated: Is not the yoga of the system, and so forth.

original: byang chub sems chen rnal 'byor gang //
analyzed: byang chub sems chen rnal 'byor gang //
translated: The yoga of the great mind of enlightenment

original: rnal 'byor dbang phyug rang nyid gtso //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dbang phyug rang nyid gtso //
translated: Is the lord of yoga himself.🔽This mind of enlightenment is the vajra,

original: byang chub sems 'di rdo rje @328b ste; ;sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems 'di rdo rje @328b ste; ;sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of all buddhas.

original: 'gro pa'i rtsal lag rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: 'gro pa'i rtsal lag rang bzhin gyis //
translated: The nature of the hand of the world

original: sna tshogs g-yogs te rnam bzhugs pas //
analyzed: sna tshogs g-yogs te rnam bzhugs pas //
translated: Resides, covered by a variety.

original: de phyir 'bad pa thams cad kyis //
analyzed: de phyir 'bad pa thams cad kyis //
translated: Therefore, with all effort,

original: sna tshogs tshul gyis mchod par bya //
analyzed: sna tshogs tshul gyis mchod par bya //
translated: one should worship in various ways.🔽I am all the Buddhas,

original: bdag nyid sangs rgyas thams cad dang // dpa' bo thams cad bdag yin te //
analyzed: bdag nyid sangs rgyas thams cad dang // dpa' bo thams cad bdag yin te //
translated: and I am all the heroes.

original: rang gi lha yi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: rang gi lha yi sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of one’s deity,

original: bdag nyid rab tu bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: bdag nyid rab tu bsgrub par bya //
translated: one should accomplish oneself.🔽By this, in this very life,🔽one will become all the Buddhas,

original: 'di yis sangs rgyas thams cad dang // dpa' bo thams cad nyid dang ni //
analyzed: 'di yis sangs rgyas thams cad dang // dpa' bo thams cad nyid dang ni //
translated: and all the heroes,

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa thams cad du //🔽tshe 'di nyid du 'grub 'gyur zhes //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa thams cad du // tshe 'di nyid du 'grub 'gyur zhes //
translated: and all the Vajradharas.🔽The glorious Bhagavān,

original: mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba'i; ;rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba'i; ;rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog /
translated: the Vajraḍāka, the supreme bliss of the union with all ḍākinīs,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
translated: the Tathāgata Vajrasattva,

original: dpal ldan bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs //
analyzed: dpal ldan bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs //
translated: has taught this.🔽Everything has the characteristic of space,

original: thams cad nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de; ;nam mkha' la ni mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: thams cad nam mkha'i mtshan nyid de; ;nam mkha' la ni mtshan nyid med //
translated: and space has no characteristic.

original: khams gsum pa ni ma lus pa'i //
analyzed: khams gsum pa ni ma lus pa'i //
translated: The entire threefold world

original: 'gro kun sgyu ma sta bu yin //🔽brtan pa dang ni g-yo ba yi //
analyzed: 'gro kun sgyu ma sta bu yin // brtan pa dang ni g-yo ba yi //
translated: is like an illusion, my son.🔽The world of the animate and inanimate

original: 'gro ba dmigs su med pa ste //
analyzed: 'gro ba dmigs su med pa ste //
translated: is not perceived.

original: mthong ba dang ni reg pa'i dngos //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ni reg pa'i dngos //
translated: All that is seen and touched

original: thams cad sgyu ma ji bzhin no //
analyzed: thams cad sgyu ma ji bzhin no //
translated: is like an illusion.

original: gang gis blun po 'ching 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang gis blun po 'ching 'gyur ba //
translated: By which the foolish are bound,

original: 'dir des mkhas rnams rnam par grol //
analyzed: 'dir des mkhas rnams rnam par grol //
translated: by that the wise are liberated.

original: phyag rgya'i sbyor ba 'di yis ni //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i sbyor ba 'di yis ni //
translated: By this application of the seal,

original: sa gsum ma lus bza' bar bya //
analyzed: sa gsum ma lus bza' bar bya //
translated: one should consume the entire triple world.

original: gzhan du gal te sbyor ba ni //
analyzed: gzhan du gal te sbyor ba ni //
translated: Otherwise, if the application is incomplete,

original: ma tshang mar me lta bur 'da'//
analyzed: ma tshang mar me lta bur 'da'//
translated: one will pass away like a fire.

original: gzugs ni sangs rgyas rnam snang mdzad //
analyzed: gzugs ni sangs rgyas rnam snang mdzad //
translated: Form is Buddha Vairocana,

original: tshor ba rdo rje nyi ma yin //
analyzed: tshor ba rdo rje nyi ma yin //
translated: feeling is Vajra Sun,

original: 'du shes @329a *//
analyzed: 'du shes @329a *//
translated: perception

original: padma gar dbang ste //
analyzed: padma gar dbang ste //
translated: is Padma Lotus Lord,

original: 'du byed rdo rje rgyal po yin //
analyzed: 'du byed rdo rje rgyal po yin //
translated: mental formations are Vajra King,

original: rnam shes rdo rje sems dpa' ste //
analyzed: rnam shes rdo rje sems dpa' ste //
translated: and consciousness is Vajra Being.

original: 'di dag dngos kun rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di dag dngos kun rang bzhin no //
translated: These are the nature of all things.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes byar grags //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes byar grags //
translated: Renowned as Vajra Dakini,

original: yang dag chen po gcig pa'i lha //
analyzed: yang dag chen po gcig pa'i lha //
translated: the deity of the sole great truth,

original: bde ba thams cad rab ster ba //
analyzed: bde ba thams cad rab ster ba //
translated: bestowing all bliss,

original: sgyu ma chen po'i rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: sgyu ma chen po'i rang bzhin gyis //
translated: by the nature of Great Illusion,

original: chags bral chags pa zhes byar bshad //
analyzed: chags bral chags pa zhes byar bshad //
translated: is explained as passionless passion.

original: sa khams ltung byed ma yin te //
analyzed: sa khams ltung byed ma yin te //
translated: The earth element is Nairtya,

original: de bzhin chu khams gsod ma'o //
analyzed: de bzhin chu khams gsod ma'o //
translated: Likewise, the water element is the killer.

original: me khams 'gugs byed ma yin te //
analyzed: me khams 'gugs byed ma yin te //
translated: The fire element is the summoner,

original: de bzhin rlung ni gar dbang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin rlung ni gar dbang ngo //
translated: and likewise, the wind is the lord of dance.🔽The space element is the great illusion,

original: nam mkha'i khams ni sgyu ma che; ;rang nyid 'gro ma zhes byar bshad //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni sgyu ma che; ;rang nyid 'gro ma zhes byar bshad //
translated: explained as the one who goes herself.

original: sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: She is united with all the buddhas,

original: mkha' 'gro ma ni 'bar ba'i mchog /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma ni 'bar ba'i mchog /
translated: the dakini of the supreme blazing.

original: 'byung ba lnga yi rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: 'byung ba lnga yi rang bzhin gyis //
translated: By the nature of the five elements,

original: de ni rdo rje gtso mor gnas //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje gtso mor gnas //
translated: she abides as the chief of the vajras.

original: mig gnyis gti mug rdo rjer bshad //
analyzed: mig gnyis gti mug rdo rjer bshad //
translated: The two eyes are said to be the vajra of stupidity,

original: nyan pa zhe sdang rdo rjer brjod //
analyzed: nyan pa zhe sdang rdo rjer brjod //
translated: and the ears are the vajra of hatred.

original: sna ni ser sna rdo rje ste /
analyzed: sna ni ser sna rdo rje ste /
translated: The nose is the vajra of avarice,

original: kha ni 'dod chags rdo rjer gsungs //
analyzed: kha ni 'dod chags rdo rjer gsungs //
translated: and the mouth is said to be the vajra of desire.🔽The body is the vajra of envy,

original: lus ni phrag dog rdo rje ste; ;skye mched thams cad mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: lus ni phrag dog rdo rje ste; ;skye mched thams cad mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: and all the sense bases are united.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog /
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog /
translated: The vajra dakini is the supreme bliss.

original: gzugs 'di thams cad stong pa nyid //
analyzed: gzugs 'di thams cad stong pa nyid //
translated: All these forms are emptiness.

original: stong pa'i tshul gyis mig gis ni //🔽dogs pa med par sgom pa'i mchog /
analyzed: stong pa'i tshul gyis mig gis ni // dogs pa med par sgom pa'i mchog /
translated: By the method of emptiness,🔽the eye meditates without doubt.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yis blta //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yis blta //
translated: View without conceptuality.

original: nam mkha'i tshul gyi sems kyis ni //
analyzed: nam mkha'i tshul gyi sems kyis ni //
translated: The mind, which is of the nature of space,

original: der ni thams cad nam mkha'i dngos //
analyzed: der ni thams cad nam mkha'i dngos //
translated: there everything is of the nature of space.

original: dgos pa med pa'i @329b sgom par ldan //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i @329b sgom par ldan //
translated: Endowed with meditation without purpose,

original: rnam par mi rtog skye 'gyur zhes //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog skye 'gyur zhes //
translated: nonconceptuality arises.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
translated: This was taught by Vajrasattva, the Tathāgata,

original: bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs //
analyzed: bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs //
translated: the Blessed One, the possessor of the vajra.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thogs pa med cing gdon mi za ba bde ba chen po'i dam tshig ces bya ba'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas 'di skad ces gsungs so //🔽ji srid 'khor ba'i gnas su ni //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thogs pa med cing gdon mi za ba bde ba chen po'i dam tshig ces bya ba'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas 'di skad ces gsungs so // ji srid 'khor ba'i gnas su ni //
translated: Then the Blessed One, having entered the meditative absorption called the stage of the all-tathāgata-unobstructed-certain-great-bliss-commitment, spoke thus:🔽As long as the supreme wise ones

original: mkhas mchog 'dug par gyur pa'i bar //
analyzed: mkhas mchog 'dug par gyur pa'i bar //
translated: remain in the abode of saṃsāra,

original: de srid sems can mtshungs med de na //
analyzed: de srid sems can mtshungs med de na //
translated: for that long those incomparable sentient beings

original: mya ngan mi 'da' bar ni mdzad //
analyzed: mya ngan mi 'da' bar ni mdzad //
translated: do not attain nirvāṇa.

original: de ltar sems can dam pa rnams //
analyzed: de ltar sems can dam pa rnams //
translated: Thus, those supreme sentient beings,

original: srid pa'i zhags pas 'jigs med par //
analyzed: srid pa'i zhags pas 'jigs med par //
translated: without fear from the noose of existence,

original: mi skyo bar ni brtson 'grus kyis //
analyzed: mi skyo bar ni brtson 'grus kyis //
translated: with diligence without weariness,

original: rtag tu sems can don rnams mdzad //
analyzed: rtag tu sems can don rnams mdzad //
translated: always accomplish the aims of sentient beings.

original: nam mkha'i gnas kyi mthas thug par //
analyzed: nam mkha'i gnas kyi mthas thug par //
translated: In the realm of space,

original: smon lam rnam par spyod byed cing //
analyzed: smon lam rnam par spyod byed cing //
translated: Conducting the aspiration,

original: sems can don brtson sems kyis ni //
analyzed: sems can don brtson sems kyis ni //
translated: With a mind striving for the benefit of sentient beings,

original: dpa' bo srid pa sbyong bar mdzad //🔽rtag tu 'dod pas myos pa yi //
analyzed: dpa' bo srid pa sbyong bar mdzad // rtag tu 'dod pas myos pa yi //
translated: The hero purifies existence.

original: lha yi bu 'di rnams dang ni //
analyzed: lha yi bu 'di rnams dang ni //
translated: These sons of gods,🔽Always intoxicated by desire,

original: gzhan yang skye bo chags can phir //
analyzed: gzhan yang skye bo chags can phir //
translated: And also for other desirous beings,

original: 'dod chags thams cad dag par mdzad //
analyzed: 'dod chags thams cad dag par mdzad //
translated: He purifies all desires.

original: bde chen shin tu grub bya'i phyir //
analyzed: bde chen shin tu grub bya'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of accomplishing great bliss,🔽He bestows the expansion of concepts,

original: rtog pa rgyas par sbyin pa dang // thog ma tha ma med pa'i mchog /
analyzed: rtog pa rgyas par sbyin pa dang // thog ma tha ma med pa'i mchog /
translated: The supreme without beginning or end,

original: rtog pa thams cad dang por bshad //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad dang por bshad //
translated: Explained first among all concepts.

original: 'das pa'i dus na sngo na byung ba //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na sngo na byung ba //
translated: In the past, in the beginning,

original: rtog pa dang po bde ba che //
analyzed: rtog pa dang po bde ba che //
translated: The first concept is great bliss.

original: der ni rdo rje sems chen gyi //
analyzed: der ni rdo rje sems chen gyi //
translated: There, the great vajra being

original: lhag pa yi ni lha @330a *//
analyzed: lhag pa yi ni lha @330a *//
translated: Resides as the supreme deity,🔽For the sake of arising for the benefit of all sentient beings

original: gcig bzhugs // 'jig rten khams rnams mtha' yas kyi //
analyzed: gcig bzhugs // 'jig rten khams rnams mtha' yas kyi //
translated: In the infinite world systems.

original: sems can kun don 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can kun don 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of the welfare of all beings,🔽He became the chief of all existence,

original: glu dang rol mo sogs pa'i gar //🔽srid pa kun gyi gtso bor gyur //
analyzed: glu dang rol mo sogs pa'i gar //🔽srid pa kun gyi gtso bor gyur //
translated: Through dance and music and so forth.

original: sems can thams cad 'byung ba yi //🔽dga' ba yang dag bsdus pa dang // de nas sems can skye 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'byung ba yi // dga' ba yang dag bsdus pa dang // de nas sems can skye 'gyur ba'i //
translated: The joy of all sentient beings🔽is gathered into the perfect joy,🔽and then the desire that sentient beings will be born

original: 'dod pa'i chags pa rnam spangs te //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i chags pa rnam spangs te //
translated: is abandoned.

original: des 'dul bar ni mkhyen nas su //
analyzed: des 'dul bar ni mkhyen nas su //
translated: Having known that they are to be disciplined,

original: yi ge las byung rnam spangs shing //
analyzed: yi ge las byung rnam spangs shing //
translated: the one who has arisen from the syllable

original: nam mkha'i lta bur bdag med par //
analyzed: nam mkha'i lta bur bdag med par //
translated: is like space, without a self,

original: dag pa nyid du de nas so na //
analyzed: dag pa nyid du de nas so na //
translated: and then is pure.🔽Then, sentient beings are unable

original: de nas sems can sangs rgyas kyi; ;bla med don ni nus med pa'i //
analyzed: de nas sems can sangs rgyas kyi; ;bla med don ni nus med pa'i //
translated: to attain the unsurpassed meaning of buddhahood,

original: stong pa nyid la rtag bzhugs pas //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la rtag bzhugs pas //
translated: and so, by always abiding in emptiness,

original: 'gro kun stong pas bcom nas ni //
analyzed: 'gro kun stong pas bcom nas ni //
translated: all beings are conquered by emptiness.

original: thams cad dmyal bar ltung mthong ste //
analyzed: thams cad dmyal bar ltung mthong ste //
translated: Seeing that everything has fallen into hell,

original: slar yang bdag dang gzhan don la //
analyzed: slar yang bdag dang gzhan don la //
translated: again, for the sake of self and other,

original: mos pas gus pa nyid du gyur //🔽de nas 'jig rten khams kun na //
analyzed: mos pas gus pa nyid du gyur // de nas 'jig rten khams kun na //
translated: one becomes devoted through interest.🔽Then, all the buddhas

original: bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kun bsdus te //
analyzed: bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas kun bsdus te //
translated: who dwell in all world systems are gathered

original: myur ba nyid du bdag la bskul //
analyzed: myur ba nyid du bdag la bskul //
translated: and quickly urged.

original: aom ma h'a su kha bdzra stva dza:h'um bam he:su ra ta stam/
analyzed: aom ma h'a su kha bdzra stva dza:h'um bam he:su ra ta stam/
translated: oṃ mahāsukha vajrasattva jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ suratasthāṃ

original: 'ongs ni bskul ba tsam gyis kyang //
analyzed: 'ongs ni bskul ba tsam gyis kyang //
translated: I am the one who comes

original: dag pa'i bde ba kun ster ba //
analyzed: dag pa'i bde ba kun ster ba //
translated: and bestows all pure bliss🔽by merely being invoked.

original: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed cing //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed cing //
translated: I am the one who accomplishes all desired aims

original: 'gro kun bde ba bskyed par gyur //
analyzed: 'gro kun bde ba bskyed par gyur //
translated: and generates the bliss of all beings.

original: nga ni 'dod pa'i gzugs kyi mchog /
analyzed: nga ni 'dod pa'i gzugs kyi mchog /
translated: I am the supreme form of desire,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis byin brlabs pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis byin brlabs pa //
translated: consecrated by all buddhas.

original: nga nyid chos kyi sku yi mchog /
analyzed: nga nyid chos kyi sku yi mchog /
translated: I am the supreme dharmakāya,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag po yin //🔽sangs rgyas kun gyi sbyor @330b 'phrog cing //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag po yin // sangs rgyas kun gyi sbyor @330b 'phrog cing //
translated: the lord of all buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi bde ba che //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi bde ba che //
translated: I am the great bliss of all buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi gsung snyan pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi gsung snyan pa //
translated: the great speech of all buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs chen yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs chen yin //
translated: and the great mind of all buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi mchod pa che //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi mchod pa che //
translated: I am the great offering of all buddhas,🔽the great king of all buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rgyal po che; ;rdo rje 'dzin pa kun gyi bdag /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rgyal po che; ;rdo rje 'dzin pa kun gyi bdag /
translated: the lord of all vajra holders,

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug kun gyi gtso //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug kun gyi gtso //
translated: and the chief of all lords of the world.

original: rin chen 'dzin pa kun gyi dbang //🔽mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor bas //
analyzed: rin chen 'dzin pa kun gyi dbang // mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor bas //
translated: I am the lord of all ratna holders,🔽and I am united with all dakinis.

original: sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam par 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam par 'gyur //
translated: I am equal to all buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam pas na //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam pas na //
translated: And is equal to all the Buddhas,

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes byar 'grub //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro zhes byar 'grub //
translated: He is accomplished as the Vajra dakini.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: Then, by the yoga of the great mandala,🔽One should draw all the mandalas,

original: de nas dkyil 'khor thams cad bri; ;de yi dbus su tshul bzhin du //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor thams cad bri; ;de yi dbus su tshul bzhin du //
translated: And in their center, in the proper way,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' gzhag par bya //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' gzhag par bya //
translated: One should place Vajrasattva.

original: zla ba'i mdog can 'dzum dang bcas //
analyzed: zla ba'i mdog can 'dzum dang bcas //
translated: He is the color of the moon, smiling,

original: 'od zer dmar po 'khrugs pa las //
analyzed: 'od zer dmar po 'khrugs pa las //
translated: Agitated by red light rays,

original: sangs rgyas phreng bas mdzes pa ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas phreng bas mdzes pa ste //
translated: Adorned with a garland of Buddhas,

original: rgyan kun gyis ni rnam par klubs //
analyzed: rgyan kun gyis ni rnam par klubs //
translated: And completely covered with all ornaments.🔽With four faces, four arms, three eyes,

original: zhal bzhi phyag bzhi spyan gsum dang // ral ba'i thor tshugs kyis brgyan cing //
analyzed: zhal bzhi phyag bzhi spyan gsum dang // ral ba'i thor tshugs kyis brgyan cing //
translated: And adorned with a crown of hair,

original: lha mo bzhi dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: lha mo bzhi dang yang dag ldan //
translated: He is endowed with four goddesses,

original: sangs rgyas gzugs kyis nye bar brgyan //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzugs kyis nye bar brgyan //
translated: And is adorned with the forms of Buddhas.

original: rtsa zhal zhi zhing g-yas dkar min //
analyzed: rtsa zhal zhi zhing g-yas dkar min //
translated: His principal face is peaceful, the right is white,

original: de bzhin gzhan yang g-yon pa dmar //
analyzed: de bzhin gzhan yang g-yon pa dmar //
translated: The left is red,

original: rgyab zhal ser po gser bsregs 'dra //
analyzed: rgyab zhal ser po gser bsregs 'dra //
translated: And the rear face is the color of burnt gold.

original: thod pa la bzhugs gar dang ldan //
analyzed: thod pa la bzhugs gar dang ldan //
translated: He stands in the midst of a charnel ground, dancing,

original: sum cu gsum pa 'jigs par mdzad //
analyzed: sum cu gsum pa 'jigs par mdzad //
translated: And is the thirty-third [Buddha].

original: rdo rje dang ni ral gri dang // dril bu thod pa bsnams pa nyid //
analyzed: rdo rje dang ni ral gri dang // dril bu thod pa bsnams pa nyid //
translated: a bell, and a skull-cup.

original: mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor los gang //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor los gang //
translated: The circle of dakinis

original: @331a *// skyob pa sna tshogs bri bar bya //
analyzed: @331a *// skyob pa sna tshogs bri bar bya //
translated: should be drawn, the protector of the world.

original: mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: The union of all dakinis

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde mchog ces //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde mchog ces //
translated: is called the Vajra Dakini Supreme Bliss.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs //
translated: Vajrasattva, the Tathagata, the Blessed One, the Vajra Holder, has taught🔽that one should be attached through the practice of desire🔽to one’s mother, sister, daughter,

original: ma dang sring mo bu mo dang // de bzhin nye du mo rnams ni //
analyzed: ma dang sring mo bu mo dang // de bzhin nye du mo rnams ni //
translated: and likewise to one’s niece,

original: dngos grub thams cad rab sgrub pas //🔽'dod pa'i sbyor bas chags par bya; ;ba lang sha dang rta sha sogs //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad rab sgrub pas // 'dod pa'i sbyor bas chags par bya; ;ba lang sha dang rta sha sogs //
translated: in order to attain all powers.🔽One should eat without hesitation

original: dogs pa med par bza' bar bya //
analyzed: dogs pa med par bza' bar bya //
translated: the flesh of cows, horses, and so forth.🔽One should always practice the left

original: 'jig rten la rtag g-yon la spyod //🔽brtan pa dang ni g-yo ba yis //
analyzed: 'jig rten la rtag g-yon la spyod // brtan pa dang ni g-yo ba yis //
translated: in the world,🔽since all beings

original: 'gro kun g-yon las byung bas ni //
analyzed: 'gro kun g-yon las byung bas ni //
translated: have arisen from the left.🔽One should eat with the left hand

original: g-yon gyis bza' zhing g-yon mchod bya //
analyzed: g-yon gyis bza' zhing g-yon mchod bya //
translated: and worship with the left.🔽One should not engage in sex

original: pho nya ma gtogs gzhan rnams la //
analyzed: pho nya ma gtogs gzhan rnams la //
translated: with anyone other than a messenger,

original: 'dod la rmongs pas bgrod mi bya //
analyzed: 'dod la rmongs pas bgrod mi bya //
translated: out of delusion regarding desire.

original: pho nya mo rtag zhen thar par //
analyzed: pho nya mo rtag zhen thar par //
translated: The messenger, always devoted,

original: 'gyur ba nyid du the tshom med //
analyzed: 'gyur ba nyid du the tshom med //
translated: will certainly attain liberation.

original: sgrub pos mchog tu 'bad byas te //
analyzed: sgrub pos mchog tu 'bad byas te //
translated: The adept should strive for the supreme,

original: brtul zhugs min spangs brtul zhugs rdzogs //
analyzed: brtul zhugs min spangs brtul zhugs rdzogs //
translated: perfecting the observances, abandoning the non-observances.🔽One should practice the conduct of the family of commitments🔽and the food of caru together.

original: dam tshig rigs la spyod pa dang // tsa ru'i bza' ba lhan cig bya; ;rigs lnga la ni kun spyod par //
analyzed: dam tshig rigs la spyod pa dang // tsa ru'i bza' ba lhan cig bya; ;rigs lnga la ni kun spyod par //
translated: One should consider the conduct of the five families

original: rigs gcig nyid du brtag par bya //
analyzed: rigs gcig nyid du brtag par bya //
translated: to be of a single family.

original: sbrang rtsi khrag dang ga bur bcas //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi khrag dang ga bur bcas //
translated: Honey, blood, and camphor,

original: tsandan dmar po sbyar byas la //
analyzed: tsandan dmar po sbyar byas la //
translated: mixed with red sandalwood,🔽mixed with vajra water,

original: rdo rje chu dang bsres pa ni; ;dngos grub thams cad sgrub byed pa'i //
analyzed: rdo rje chu dang bsres pa ni; ;dngos grub thams cad sgrub byed pa'i //
translated: is the means of accomplishing all powers.

original: de dag bdud rtsi lngar ni 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag bdud rtsi lngar ni 'gyur //
translated: Those are the five nectars.

original: mthe bo srin lag sbyar ba yis //
analyzed: mthe bo srin lag sbyar ba yis //
translated: With the thumb and ring finger joined,

original: rnal 'byor rig pas rtag tu bza'//
analyzed: rnal 'byor rig pas rtag tu bza'//
translated: the yogin, knowing reality, should always eat.

original: zhi ba'i btung ba @331b bzhin myangs na //
analyzed: zhi ba'i btung ba @331b bzhin myangs na //
translated: Having tasted the drink of peace,

original: dengs grub rtag pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: dengs grub rtag pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: one will attain the eternal accomplishment.

original: 'di dag dam tshig dam ba ste //
analyzed: 'di dag dam tshig dam ba ste //
translated: These are the supreme commitments,

original: mdzes ma'i gdong can khyod la bshad //
analyzed: mdzes ma'i gdong can khyod la bshad //
translated: which I have explained to you, O beautiful-faced one.

original: las rnams kun la thabs bcas shing //
analyzed: las rnams kun la thabs bcas shing //
translated: The means for all actions,

original: dogs pa med par gang spyod dang // rnam par mi rtog sgom pa ni //
analyzed: dogs pa med par gang spyod dang // rnam par mi rtog sgom pa ni //
translated: and meditated on nonconceptually,

original: brtul zhugs rnams kyi mchog gi mchog /
analyzed: brtul zhugs rnams kyi mchog gi mchog /
translated: that is the supreme of all austerities.

original: las rnams kun la kun tu ni //🔽rnam par mi rtog sgom byed cing //
analyzed: las rnams kun la kun tu ni // rnam par mi rtog sgom byed cing //
translated: In all actions,🔽meditating nonconceptually

original: dogs pa med par kun tu spyod //
analyzed: dogs pa med par kun tu spyod //
translated: and practicing without doubt,

original: de ni dka' thub rnams kyi mchog /
analyzed: de ni dka' thub rnams kyi mchog /
translated: that is the supreme of all austerities.

original: the tshom med pa'i sems kyis ni //🔽skra zla la sogs rjes dngos kyi //
analyzed: the tshom med pa'i sems kyis ni // skra zla la sogs rjes dngos kyi //
translated: With a mind free of doubt,🔽enjoying all objects

original: yul rnams ma lus sten byed pa'i //
analyzed: yul rnams ma lus sten byed pa'i //
translated: without exception, such as alcohol and meat,

original: dka' thub shin tu 'da' dka' ba'o //
analyzed: dka' thub shin tu 'da' dka' ba'o //
translated: that is the most difficult austerity to transgress.

original: gang yang las rnams thams cad la //
analyzed: gang yang las rnams thams cad la //
translated: Whatever all actions

original: shes rab dang ni sbyar byas te //
analyzed: shes rab dang ni sbyar byas te //
translated: are joined with wisdom

original: de yang stong pa'i gnas su sbyar //
analyzed: de yang stong pa'i gnas su sbyar //
translated: and also applied to the state of emptiness,

original: de 'dir bdag chen dka' thub yin //
analyzed: de 'dir bdag chen dka' thub yin //
translated: that is the great austerity of the self.

original: rnam par mi rtog sems kyis ni //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog sems kyis ni //
translated: With a nonconceptual mind,

original: shes rab dang ni mtshungs gzugs la //
analyzed: shes rab dang ni mtshungs gzugs la //
translated: having a form that is similar to wisdom,

original: dogs med spyod pa'i kun spyod pa //
analyzed: dogs med spyod pa'i kun spyod pa //
translated: practicing the conduct without doubt,

original: de ni bdag chen dka' thub yin //
analyzed: de ni bdag chen dka' thub yin //
translated: that is the great austerity of the self.

original: shes rab thabs ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: shes rab thabs ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Except for wisdom and method,

original: gang tshe byams gzhan mi g-yo na //🔽de tshe byang chub chen po ni //
analyzed: gang tshe byams gzhan mi g-yo na // de tshe byang chub chen po ni //
translated: When love is not shaken by other things,🔽then it is said to be the bestower

original: nges par ster ba nyid du bshad //
analyzed: nges par ster ba nyid du bshad //
translated: of the great enlightenment.🔽The yogi/nī who is intent

original: rnam par mi rtog rjes 'jug la //🔽rnal 'byor pa ni mngon par brtson //🔽de ni thams cad 'byung ba yi //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog rjes 'jug la // rnal 'byor pa ni mngon par brtson // de ni thams cad 'byung ba yi //
translated: on the non-conceptual state

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa yin //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa yin //
translated: is the perfection of wisdom

original: gang tshe 'dus byas tshul rnams ni //
analyzed: gang tshe 'dus byas tshul rnams ni //
translated: which is the source of everything.

original: rnam par mi rtog sems @332a *//
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog sems @332a *//
translated: When the yogi/nī, with a non-conceptual mind,🔽knows the way of the conditioned

original: kyis su // me long lta bur rab shes pa //
analyzed: kyis su // me long lta bur rab shes pa //
translated: like a reflection in a mirror,

original: de ni shes rab bsten pa yin //
analyzed: de ni shes rab bsten pa yin //
translated: that is the practice of wisdom.🔽When the way of the conditioned

original: glog dang chu bur ltar smin pa //🔽gang tshe 'dus byas tshul rnams ni //
analyzed: glog dang chu bur ltar smin pa // gang tshe 'dus byas tshul rnams ni //
translated: is seen like a flash of lightning or a water bubble,

original: gang gis ji ltar mthong 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang gis ji ltar mthong 'gyur ba //
translated: however it is seen,

original: de ni shes rab bsten pa yin //🔽me long nang gi gzugs brnyan dang // rmi lam sgyu ma dri za'i grol //
analyzed: de ni shes rab bsten pa yin // me long nang gi gzugs brnyan dang // rmi lam sgyu ma dri za'i grol //
translated: that is the practice of wisdom.🔽Whoever sees the conditioned🔽like a reflection in a mirror, a dream, an illusion, a mirage,

original: mig 'phrul mtshungs par gang gis mthong //
analyzed: mig 'phrul mtshungs par gang gis mthong //
translated: or a magical display,

original: de ni gtso bo yin par brjod //
analyzed: de ni gtso bo yin par brjod //
translated: is said to be the best.

original: de ni gang du'ang mngon zhen dang // gang du'ang gnas pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de ni gang du'ang mngon zhen dang // gang du'ang gnas pa yod ma yin //
translated: and no abiding in anything.

original: de ltar yang dag 'byung mod kyi //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag 'byung mod kyi //
translated: Even so, the right thing to do is this:

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i dngos dag ni //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i dngos dag ni //
translated: The things that are like illusions

original: longs spyod khyad 'phags skye 'gyur ba //
analyzed: longs spyod khyad 'phags skye 'gyur ba //
translated: give rise to special enjoyments.

original: bde ba yongs su 'gyur bzhin pas //
analyzed: bde ba yongs su 'gyur bzhin pas //
translated: The transformation of happiness

original: 'bras bu khyad 'phags thob 'gyur par //
analyzed: 'bras bu khyad 'phags thob 'gyur par //
translated: brings about the attainment of special results.

original: ci yi phyir na 'dod mi bya //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na 'dod mi bya //
translated: Why would one not want that?

original: brtan g-yo'i dngos po yod min te //
analyzed: brtan g-yo'i dngos po yod min te //
translated: The entities of the animate and inanimate worlds do not exist,

original: 'on kyang snang ba tsam mtshan nyid //
analyzed: 'on kyang snang ba tsam mtshan nyid //
translated: but their mere appearance is their defining characteristic.

original: sgom pa khyad par can gang zhig /
analyzed: sgom pa khyad par can gang zhig /
translated: The special meditation

original: goms pa'i stobs ni rdzogs pa na //
analyzed: goms pa'i stobs ni rdzogs pa na //
translated: is the perfection of the power of practice.

original: yid 'od bde ba'i 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: yid 'od bde ba'i 'bras bu ni //
translated: The result is the delightful fruit of happiness,

original: bla med gsal ba'i blo yi mthu //
analyzed: bla med gsal ba'i blo yi mthu //
translated: the power of the clear mind of the highest.

original: 'bras bu don gnyer rgyu bsgrubs na //
analyzed: 'bras bu don gnyer rgyu bsgrubs na //
translated: When one has accomplished the cause that is aimed at the result,

original: der ni lha mo su zhig 'gog /
analyzed: der ni lha mo su zhig 'gog /
translated: what goddess would block that?

original: de bas 'bad pa thams cad kyis //
analyzed: de bas 'bad pa thams cad kyis //
translated: Therefore, with all one’s effort,

original: kun tu 'gro ba mchod par bya //🔽dka' thub sdom pa mi bzad pas //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba mchod par bya // dka' thub sdom pa mi bzad pas //
translated: one should make offerings to the all-pervading one.🔽The body is dried up and suffers

original: lus ni bskams shing sdug bsngal 'gyur //
analyzed: lus ni bskams shing sdug bsngal 'gyur //
translated: from the unbearable vows of asceticism.

original: sdug bsngal gyis ni sems g-yengs na //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis ni sems g-yengs na //
translated: If the mind is distracted by suffering,

original: g-yengs pas @332b dngos grub gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yengs pas @332b dngos grub gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: distracted, accomplishment will be otherwise.

original: lus dang sems ni brtan gyur na //
analyzed: lus dang sems ni brtan gyur na //
translated: If the body and mind are firm,

original: bde ba thams cad brtan par 'gyur //
analyzed: bde ba thams cad brtan par 'gyur //
translated: all happiness will be firm.

original: sdug bsngal gyis ni g-yo gyur pas //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis ni g-yo gyur pas //
translated: If one is distracted by suffering,🔽one will go to a very bad place.

original: shin tu 'gog par 'gro bar 'gyur; ;des na lus dang ngag sems rnams //
analyzed: shin tu 'gog par 'gro bar 'gyur; ;des na lus dang ngag sems rnams //
translated: Therefore, having made the body, speech, and mind firm,

original: brtan par byas nas byang chub thob //
analyzed: brtan par byas nas byang chub thob //
translated: one attains enlightenment.🔽Otherwise, one will die at the wrong time,

original: gzhan du dus min 'chi ba dang // dmyal bar nges par sreg 'gyur zhes //🔽mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
analyzed: gzhan du dus min 'chi ba dang // dmyal bar nges par sreg 'gyur zhes // mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
translated: and will certainly be burned in hell.🔽The Vajraḍāka,

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog /
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog /
translated: the supreme bliss of the Vajraḍāka,

original: rdo rje sems dang de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dang de bzhin gshegs //
translated: the Vajrasattva, and the Tathāgata,

original: bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs //🔽rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro las //
analyzed: bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs // rgyud kyi rgyal po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro las //
translated: the Blessed One, the Vajra Holder, has said.

original: de kho na nyid snang ba dam pa'i yul la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyi rim par phye ba dang po'o ////
analyzed: de kho na nyid snang ba dam pa'i yul la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyi rim par phye ba dang po'o ////
translated: This concludes the first section of the chapter on the stages of wisdom entering the domain of the supreme appearance of reality from the glorious King of Tantras, the Vajraḍāka.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la btsun mo rnams kyis slar yang mchod cing phyag byas nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la btsun mo rnams kyis slar yang mchod cing phyag byas nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the queens again made offerings to the Blessed One, bowed down, and said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: snying po gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bstan pa 'bral pa'i lha la sogs pa'i gdug pa can rnams dang / skye bo gdug pa can gzhan dag kyang gdul ba dang / 'joms pa dang / zhum par byed pa dang / ltung ba dang /
analyzed: snying po gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bstan pa 'bral pa'i lha la sogs pa'i gdug pa can rnams dang / skye bo gdug pa can gzhan dag kyang gdul ba dang / 'joms pa dang / zhum par byed pa dang / ltung ba dang /
translated: please teach the essence that subjugates all the teachings of the tathāgatas, the wicked gods and others, and other wicked people, and that subdues, conquers, intimidates, overthrows,

original: zhi bar byas te byang chub kyi snying po'i bar du gnod pa byed par mi 'gyur ba'i snying po sdang ba thams cad rab tu 'joms pa lhas bshad du gsol //
analyzed: zhi bar byas te byang chub kyi snying po'i bar du gnod pa byed par mi 'gyur ba'i snying po sdang ba thams cad rab tu 'joms pa lhas bshad du gsol //
translated: and pacifies them, so that they will not harm up to the essence of enlightenment. Please teach the essence that completely conquers all hatred.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de @333a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de @333a *//
translated: Then the Blessed One,

original: bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs rdo rje'i bdag pos glur blangs te 'di skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang / gsung dang / thugs rdo rje'i bdag pos glur blangs te 'di skad ces gsungs so //
translated: the lord of the vajra body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas, sang this song:

original: dang bor rnam par snang mdzad gnas //
analyzed: dang bor rnam par snang mdzad gnas //
translated: “First, Vairocana abides,

original: der ni sde mtshan rnams kyi mtha'//
analyzed: der ni sde mtshan rnams kyi mtha'//
translated: The end of the [first] group is [the letter]

original: ta dang po yi dha bha'i mtha'//
analyzed: ta dang po yi dha bha'i mtha'//
translated: at the end of the first ta, and the end of the bha.

original: dbyangs kyi gsum pas spyir brgyan pa'i //🔽sa yi mtha' ni rang gis blta //
analyzed: dbyangs kyi gsum pas spyir brgyan pa'i // sa yi mtha' ni rang gis blta //
translated: The third vowel [a] is the general ornament.🔽The end of the [first] group is [the letter]

original: la sa'i dbus kyi stan bzhugs pa'i //🔽sa yi mtha' ni sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: la sa'i dbus kyi stan bzhugs pa'i // sa yi mtha' ni sbyar bar bya //
translated: at the end of the sa, which is placed in the middle of the la and sa.🔽The end of the [second] group is [the letter]

original: mda' gnyis kyis ni rnam par sbyangs //

original: parsha ba / dza he sv'ah'a /
analyzed: parsha ba / dza he sv'ah'a /
translated: Jahesvaha

original: zhib ma'i nang du chu blugs la sngags 'di lan bdun bzlas te rlung phyogs su nam mkha' la gtor na /
analyzed: zhib ma'i nang du chu blugs la sngags 'di lan bdun bzlas te rlung phyogs su nam mkha' la gtor na /
translated: Pour water into a fine sieve, recite this mantra seven times, and scatter it into the sky in the direction of the wind.

original: rlung dang / char dang / ser ba la sogs pa bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung dang / char dang / ser ba la sogs pa bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will stop the wind, rain, hail, and so forth.

original: na ya mo dhe /
analyzed: na ya mo dhe /
translated: Nayamo dhe

original: bha ga ba te /
analyzed: bha ga ba te /
translated: Bhagavate

original: ki bhi ku re na sha tra ya /
analyzed: ki bhi ku re na sha tra ya /
translated: Kibhi kurena shatraye

original: tha ma ke ha tha ka ra la b'a ke ni ta som ru bi ti bi bha tu ya /
analyzed: tha ma ke ha tha ka ra la b'a ke ni ta som ru bi ti bi bha tu ya /
translated: Thamake hata kara lavake nitasomaruvi bhatuya

original: ru tsha re ta ra ma /
analyzed: ru tsha re ta ra ma /
translated: Rutsare taram

original: ta ku ke to la ti ku ke ti lit lu ya //
analyzed: ta ku ke to la ti ku ke ti lit lu ya //
translated: Takuket olatitakuket itiluluya

original: lu dam hi shtha lo ka si ra le lo ti gra le bhi shi sha le na si mu le kha /
analyzed: lu dam hi shtha lo ka si ra le lo ti gra le bhi shi sha le na si mu le kha /
translated: Ludam histhalo kasiralelolati gra lebhishi shalena simulekha

original: aa ya the sarba ha de sra na bhu dza ku bha na su the ra sha ya //
analyzed: aa ya the sarba ha de sra na bhu dza ku bha na su the ra sha ya //
translated: Ayathe sarva ha de saranabhuja kubhana sutherashaya

original: na pa la @338a *//
analyzed: na pa la @338a *//
translated: Na palara

original: ra tishu dha ya na sho pa dya ti ta ka su se la ka kha se tam ghe gha se dha gha ri sa ne /
analyzed: ra tishu dha ya na sho pa dya ti ta ka su se la ka kha se tam ghe gha se dha gha ri sa ne /
translated: Tishadhaya nashopayati takasuselakakhasattam gheghesedhagarisane

original: ma by'a ha gha gha dze sen gham ba sa ra /
analyzed: ma by'a ha gha gha dze sen gham ba sa ra /
translated: Mavaha gha gha jensen ghamvabasa ra

original: gha dha se ra sa aa ha /
analyzed: gha dha se ra sa aa ha /
translated: Ghadhasarasāha.

original: aa aom ha pi ru ga aam bra la aandha ksha ka aa ra h'um h'um h'um ba pha puta sha ya /
analyzed: aa aom ha pi ru ga aam bra la aandha ksha ka aa ra h'um h'um h'um ba pha puta sha ya /
translated: Oṃ ha pīru gaṃ braḥ la andhakṣa kara hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ va pha puṭa śaya.

original: zla tshes thig ler ldan pa'i aos //
analyzed: zla tshes thig ler ldan pa'i aos //
translated: The syllable oṃ with the crescent moon and drop

original: rkang pa brgyad pa mdzes par bya //
analyzed: rkang pa brgyad pa mdzes par bya //
translated: should be placed at the beginning of the eight-line verse.

original: sv'ah'a zhes byas brgyan pa ste //
analyzed: sv'ah'a zhes byas brgyan pa ste //
translated: It should be adorned with the word svāhā

original: mtha' dang mthar ni phat mchog bya //
analyzed: mtha' dang mthar ni phat mchog bya //
translated: and at the end and the beginning, the supreme phaṭ.

original: 'di ni gsungs pa tsam gyis kyang //
analyzed: 'di ni gsungs pa tsam gyis kyang //
translated: By merely reciting this,

original: klu rnams skrag cing brgyal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: klu rnams skrag cing brgyal bar 'gyur //
translated: the nāgas will be frightened and faint.

original: sngags kyi rgyal po 'di'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: sngags kyi rgyal po 'di'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application of this king of mantras

original: 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di yin te /
translated: is as follows:🔽The mantrin visualizes himself as Vajrahūṃkāra with four faces,

original: sngags pa bdag nyid rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rdo rje h'um mdzad zhal bzhi pa /
analyzed: sngags pa bdag nyid rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i rdo rje h'um mdzad zhal bzhi pa /
translated: standing on a wind and fire maṇḍala,

original: phyag bzhi pa /
analyzed: phyag bzhi pa /
translated: with four arms,

original: 'dam skyes sngon po lta bu mdog can sangs rgyas lnga'i me tog gi phreng bas dbu brgyan pa /
analyzed: 'dam skyes sngon po lta bu mdog can sangs rgyas lnga'i me tog gi phreng bas dbu brgyan pa /
translated: the color of a blue lotus, his head adorned with a garland of flowers of the five buddhas,

original: bskal pa'i me ltar 'bar ba /
analyzed: bskal pa'i me ltar 'bar ba /
translated: blazing like the fire at the end of the eon,

original: yan lag gi cha shas thams cad nas rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma spro zhing zhal bzhi nas h'um bzhi sgrogs par mdzad par bya'o //🔽de nas kham phor gnyis bzung ste kham phor gnyis po de ba blas rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor rang gi mtshan mas mdzad cing 'bar ba la /
analyzed: yan lag gi cha shas thams cad nas rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma spro zhing zhal bzhi nas h'um bzhi sgrogs par mdzad par bya'o // de nas kham phor gnyis bzung ste kham phor gnyis po de ba blas rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor rang gi mtshan mas mdzad cing 'bar ba la /
translated: One should emanate Vajra dakinis from all the parts of the body, and make them utter the four HŪMs from the four faces.

original: klu brgyad kyi dkyil 'khor re'u mig dgu par bris te /
analyzed: klu brgyad kyi dkyil 'khor re'u mig dgu par bris te /
translated: Then, taking two bowls, one should draw the maṇḍala of the eight nāgas in the two bowls with one’s own sign, blazing with the wind and fire maṇḍalas.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su klu lhag ma can mgo la gdengs ka bdun gyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su klu lhag ma can mgo la gdengs ka bdun gyis brgyan pa /
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala, one should draw the nāga Śeṣa, adorned with seven hoods on his head,

original: cung zad bskum pa'i phyed krung can du bri /
analyzed: cung zad bskum pa'i phyed krung can du bri /
translated: drawn in the half-cross-legged posture with a slight bend.

original: de'i brla @338b g-yon pa la gnas par klu mo gdengs ka gsum dang ldan pa g-yon gyis 'khyud par bri /
analyzed: de'i brla @338b g-yon pa la gnas par klu mo gdengs ka gsum dang ldan pa g-yon gyis 'khyud par bri /
translated: On his left thigh, one should draw the nāginī with three hoods, embracing him with her left [hand].

original: de ltar phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su mtha' yas la sogs pa bris la /
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su mtha' yas la sogs pa bris la /
translated: In that way, one should draw Ananta and so on in the outer maṇḍalas.

original: gdengs ka rnams la h'um dang spel ba'i phu bkod de thams cad kyi lag pa g-yas na ral gri thogs pa'o //
analyzed: gdengs ka rnams la h'um dang spel ba'i phu bkod de thams cad kyi lag pa g-yas na ral gri thogs pa'o //
translated: One should arrange the HŪṃs in the hoods, and all of them hold swords in their right hands.

original: dpral ba rnams su yang h'um phu h'um/
analyzed: dpral ba rnams su yang h'um phu h'um/
translated: Also, on their foreheads, one should write hūṃ phaṭ hūṃ.

original: rkang mthil rnams la dza bri /
analyzed: rkang mthil rnams la dza bri /
translated: On the soles of their feet, one should write jaṃ bṛṃ.

original: rkang pa rnams kyang klu gzhan gyis bcings pa ste de dag gi gdengs ka la yang h'um phu h'um bri'o //
analyzed: rkang pa rnams kyang klu gzhan gyis bcings pa ste de dag gi gdengs ka la yang h'um phu h'um bri'o //
translated: Also, their feet are bound by other nāgas. On their hoods, one should write hūṃ phaṭ hūṃ.

original: de nas aom dhri aa ni la ta ra pe ga di thi bi ba ra she she ya hi ru sarbba n'a ga ku la bya na ya phu /
analyzed: de nas aom dhri aa ni la ta ra pe ga di thi bi ba ra she she ya hi ru sarbba n'a ga ku la bya na ya phu /
translated: Then, with oṃ dhṛ i anila tarapeda gati vibara śeṣeya hi ru sarvanāga kula bya na ya phu,

original: sa ma ye pra pe sha ya phu /
analyzed: sa ma ye pra pe sha ya phu /
translated: samaye praveśaya phu,

original: sarbba na s'a dha ya phu: phu: phu: phu: zhes bya ba 'dis dkyil 'khor bskor la yang sngags 'di dang / phyag rgyas so so'i lus la bkug ste gzhug par bya'o //🔽phyag rgya ni /
analyzed: sarbba na s'a dha ya phu: phu: phu: phu: zhes bya ba 'dis dkyil 'khor bskor la yang sngags 'di dang / phyag rgyas so so'i lus la bkug ste gzhug par bya'o // phyag rgya ni /
translated: sarvanāga sādhaya phu phu phu phu, one should circle the maṇḍala and, with this mantra and the mudra, summon and induct them into each body.

original: 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di yin te /
translated: The mudra is as follows:

original: mthe bong kha sbyar te bcings la phyi rol tu bzhag ste sor mo lhag ma rnams gdengs ka ltar bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthe bong kha sbyar te bcings la phyi rol tu bzhag ste sor mo lhag ma rnams gdengs ka ltar bya ba'o //
translated: Having bound the añjali with the thumbs joined, one should extend the other fingers like hoods.

original: dza:h'um bam ho zhes bya ba sngags kyi mthar bzla zhing dgug pa dang / gzhug pa la sogs pa byas la /
analyzed: dza:h'um bam ho zhes bya ba sngags kyi mthar bzla zhing dgug pa dang / gzhug pa la sogs pa byas la /
translated: Reciting jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ at the end of the mantra, one should perform the summoning, inducting, and so on.

original: de de nas kham phor de mar nag tsha bas bkangs te sdong bu la me sbar la /
analyzed: de de nas kham phor de mar nag tsha bas bkangs te sdong bu la me sbar la /
translated: Then, having covered the bowl with hot oil, light the wick.

original: kham phor gzhan gyis bkab la /
analyzed: kham phor gzhan gyis bkab la /
translated: Cover it with another bowl.

original: kham phor de ri rab tu bsgoms nas de'i steng du h'um gis khro bo'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms la /
analyzed: kham phor de ri rab tu bsgoms nas de'i steng du h'um gis khro bo'i dkyil 'khor bsgoms la /
translated: Having meditated on that bowl as Mount Meru, meditate on the mandala of the wrathful ones with HŪṂ on top of it.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te cho ga bzhin du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te cho ga bzhin du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Recite the mantra of Vajra HŪṃkara one hundred and eight times and place it in accordance with the rite.

original: de nas @339a *//
analyzed: de nas @339a *//
translated: Then,

original: kham phor gyi steng du bsgoms pa'i rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa'i khro bo'i dkyil 'khor ba'i lus kyi gzar bu las byung ba'i chu rdo rje nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la mthong bar bsam la /
analyzed: kham phor gyi steng du bsgoms pa'i rdo rje h'um mdzad la sogs pa'i khro bo'i dkyil 'khor ba'i lus kyi gzar bu las byung ba'i chu rdo rje nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la mthong bar bsam la /
translated: having meditated on the mandala of the wrathful ones such as Vajra HŪṃkara on top of the bowl, imagine that the water that arises from the ladle of the body of the mandala of the wrathful ones is seen in the maṇḍala of the vajra sun.

original: bdag nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas zhal bzhi nas h'um bzhi sgrogs shing rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgya bcings pa'i mdzub mo'i rtse mor h'um gnyis bsgoms te de las byung ba'i me lce'i phreng bas sprin rnams bzlog par bsam ste dpal
analyzed: bdag nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas zhal bzhi nas h'um bzhi sgrogs shing rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgya bcings pa'i mdzub mo'i rtse mor h'um gnyis bsgoms te de las byung ba'i me lce'i phreng bas sprin rnams bzlog par bsam ste dpal
translated: Endowed with the yoga of Vajrahūṃkāra, one should imagine that one utters the four hūṃs from the four faces, and that one forms the mudrā of Vajrahūṃkāra, and that two hūṃs are visualized at the tips of the index fingers, and that the garland of flames that arises from them wards off the clouds.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sngags kyang rung ba bzla'o //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sngags kyang rung ba bzla'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra of Śrī Vajrahūṃkāra.

original: sbyor ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba 'dis ni /
translated: By this yoga,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol khru brgyad kyi bar du char bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol khru brgyad kyi bar du char bzlog par bya'o //
translated: one should ward off the rain up to a distance of eight cubits outside the maṇḍala.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: With the yoga of the great maṇḍala,

original: phyi yi dkyil 'khor bri bar bya //
analyzed: phyi yi dkyil 'khor bri bar bya //
translated: one should draw the outer maṇḍala.

original: de yi dbus gyur padma ni //
analyzed: de yi dbus gyur padma ni //
translated: In its center, one should visualize

original: kha dog dkar po mdzes pa la //
analyzed: kha dog dkar po mdzes pa la //
translated: a beautiful white lotus,

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dbus gnas pa'i //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dbus gnas pa'i //
translated: in the center of a sun maṇḍala,

original: ye shes sa bon bsgom par bya //
analyzed: ye shes sa bon bsgom par bya //
translated: the seed of gnosis.

original: rlung dang me yi dbus gnas par //
analyzed: rlung dang me yi dbus gnas par //
translated: In the center of wind and fire,

original: chu yi dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya //
analyzed: chu yi dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya //
translated: one should visualize the water maṇḍala.

original: dbang chen dkyil 'khor dbus su ni //
analyzed: dbang chen dkyil 'khor dbus su ni //
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala of the great lord,

original: gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor rab bsgoms te //🔽zla ba rdo rje'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: gsal ba'i dkyil 'khor rab bsgoms te // zla ba rdo rje'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: Having well meditated on the mandala of the clear,🔽with the yoga of the moon and vajra,

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bsgom bya ba //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bsgom bya ba //
translated: one should meditate on Vajraḍāka.

original: zhal gcig phyag ni bzhi pa ste //
analyzed: zhal gcig phyag ni bzhi pa ste //
translated: He has one face and four arms,

original: glang chen stan la g-yas brkyang bzhugs //
analyzed: glang chen stan la g-yas brkyang bzhugs //
translated: stands on an elephant seat with right leg extended,

original: spyan gsum skra ni grol bas brgyan //
analyzed: spyan gsum skra ni grol bas brgyan //
translated: has three eyes, and is adorned with loose hair.

original: gzugs bzang gzhon pa phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: gzugs bzang gzhon pa phun sum tshogs //
translated: He is well-formed, youthful, and perfect,

original: thod pa'i phreng ba rnam par @339b klubs //
analyzed: thod pa'i phreng ba rnam par @339b klubs //
translated: adorned with a garland of skulls,

original: kha dog dmar po gsal ba'i mdangs //
analyzed: kha dog dmar po gsal ba'i mdangs //
translated: red in color, with a radiant complexion,

original: shin tu mdzes pa'i na bza' gsol //
analyzed: shin tu mdzes pa'i na bza' gsol //
translated: and wears a very beautiful garment.

original: 'bar ba'i ral gri thod pa dang / mnga' dang gzhu ni 'gengs pa ste //
analyzed: 'bar ba'i ral gri thod pa dang / mnga' dang gzhu ni 'gengs pa ste //
translated: He holds a blazing sword, skull-cup, seal, and draws a bow,

original: khrag la dgyes pa'i hr'i las byung //
analyzed: khrag la dgyes pa'i hr'i las byung //
translated: arisen from the activity of Hṛīḥ, delighted in blood.

original: 'od zer dmar po'i phreng 'khrugs shing //
analyzed: 'od zer dmar po'i phreng 'khrugs shing //
translated: Agitated by a garland of red light

original: 'jigs pa dag kyang 'jigs par mdzad //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dag kyang 'jigs par mdzad //
translated: frightening even the fearful,🔽one should meditate on the wheel of ḍākinīs

original: gru bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa'i //🔽mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor lo bsgom //
analyzed: gru bzhi pa la sgo bzhi pa'i // mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor lo bsgom //
translated: in the four corners with four gates.🔽Having hung up a fine canopy

original: bla re dam pa bres pa dang // rlung bskyod ba dan bsgrengs nas ni //
analyzed: bla re dam pa bres pa dang // rlung bskyod ba dan bsgrengs nas ni //
translated: and raised banners moved by the wind,

original: sna tshogs gos ni rnam dpyangs par //🔽dur khrod so phag la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: sna tshogs gos ni rnam dpyangs par // dur khrod so phag la sogs pa'i //
translated: And various garments hanging down.🔽In the charnel ground, with the five colors

original: tshon rtsi rnam pa lnga yis ni //
analyzed: tshon rtsi rnam pa lnga yis ni //
translated: Of bricks and so forth,

original: khru bzhi pa yi tshad tsam du //
analyzed: khru bzhi pa yi tshad tsam du //
translated: The size of the maṇḍala is four cubits,

original: dkyil 'khor dge ba'i las tsam sogs //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dge ba'i las tsam sogs //
translated: And so forth, according to the amount of merit.

original: de nas rdzing bu bya ba ni //
analyzed: de nas rdzing bu bya ba ni //
translated: Then, the pond is made

original: tshon rtsi sngon pos gcal bkram ste //
analyzed: tshon rtsi sngon pos gcal bkram ste //
translated: With a spread of blue color,

original: rba rlabs chu gnyer la sogs bri //
analyzed: rba rlabs chu gnyer la sogs bri //
translated: And waves, ripples, and so forth are drawn.

original: tshon chen gyis ni gang ba'i gzugs //
analyzed: tshon chen gyis ni gang ba'i gzugs //
translated: The form filled with great color🔽Is drawn with various kinds of creatures,

original: nya dang nya mid la sogs pa'i //🔽srog chags rnam pa sna tshogs bri //
analyzed: nya dang nya mid la sogs pa'i // srog chags rnam pa sna tshogs bri //
translated: Such as fish, whales, and so forth.

original: phyi rol bya rog sogs pas brgyan //
analyzed: phyi rol bya rog sogs pas brgyan //
translated: Outside, it is adorned with crows and so forth.

original: de nas cho ga 'di yis ni //
analyzed: de nas cho ga 'di yis ni //
translated: Then, with this rite,🔽The eight great nāgas and the eight nāgas are placed.

original: rig pa che dang klu brgyad dgod; ;sgo bzhir mgo gnyis bsnol ba la //
analyzed: rig pa che dang klu brgyad dgod; ;sgo bzhir mgo gnyis bsnol ba la //
translated: In the four corners, the four nāgas are placed,

original: mjug mas grva bzhir dkris nas su //
analyzed: mjug mas grva bzhir dkris nas su //
translated: With their tails entwined around the four corners.

original: shar du klu rgyal mtha' yas ni //
analyzed: shar du klu rgyal mtha' yas ni //
translated: In the east, the nāga king Ananta

original: 'dam skyes sngon po lta bu'i mdog /🔽gdengs ka bdun ni bsgyings pa la //
analyzed: 'dam skyes sngon po lta bu'i mdog / gdengs ka bdun ni bsgyings pa la //
translated: Is the color of a blue lotus flower,🔽With seven hoods extended,

original: klu mo dang ni bcas par dgod //
analyzed: klu mo dang ni bcas par dgod //
translated: And is placed together with the nāgī.

original: phyag na padma bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: phyag na padma bsnams pa'o //
translated: He holds a lotus in his hand.

original: byang du nor rgyas ser po ste nub tu 'jog pa dmar po yin //
analyzed: byang du nor rgyas ser po ste nub tu 'jog pa dmar po yin //
translated: In the north, yellow Vāsuki; in the west, red Padma;

original: lho ru stobs rgyu ljang skya ste /🔽@340a *// dbang ldan du ni dung skyong yin //🔽rlung mtshams padma bden bral du //
analyzed: lho ru stobs rgyu ljang skya ste / @340a *// dbang ldan du ni dung skyong yin // rlung mtshams padma bden bral du //
translated: in the south, light-green Śaṅkhapāla;🔽in the northeast, Śaṅkhapāla;🔽in the southwest, Padma;

original: padma chen po dgod par bya //
analyzed: padma chen po dgod par bya //
translated: in the northwest, Mahāpadma;

original: me mtshams su ni rigs ldan re //
analyzed: me mtshams su ni rigs ldan re //
translated: in the southeast, Kulika;

original: chog snga mas bri bar bya //
analyzed: chog snga mas bri bar bya //
translated: he should be drawn as before.

original: klu ni brgyad pa thams cad kyang //
analyzed: klu ni brgyad pa thams cad kyang //
translated: All eight nāgas

original: rin chen ced pan lta ldug ldan //
analyzed: rin chen ced pan lta ldug ldan //
translated: are adorned with jeweled crowns,

original: rgyan kun gyis ni rnam par klubs //
analyzed: rgyan kun gyis ni rnam par klubs //
translated: adorned with all ornaments,

original: gdengs ka'i nor bu'i 'od kyis ni //
analyzed: gdengs ka'i nor bu'i 'od kyis ni //
translated: with the light of the jewel hood

original: mun pa thams cad sel byed pa //
analyzed: mun pa thams cad sel byed pa //
translated: dispelling all darkness.

original: thal mo sbyar zhing skrag nas su //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar zhing skrag nas su //
translated: With palms joined, frightened,

original: gdengs ka las ni chu rgyun 'bebs //
analyzed: gdengs ka las ni chu rgyun 'bebs //
translated: water flows from the hood.

original: sprin gyi dbang phyug rgyal po rnams //
analyzed: sprin gyi dbang phyug rgyal po rnams //
translated: The lords of the clouds, the kings,

original: phyogs brgyad nas ni dgug par bya //
analyzed: phyogs brgyad nas ni dgug par bya //
translated: should be summoned from the eight directions.🔽Speech, sound, and stupefaction,

original: smra grag dang ni rmugs pa dang // drag po 'gugs byed de bzhin no //
analyzed: smra grag dang ni rmugs pa dang // drag po 'gugs byed de bzhin no //
translated: and likewise, the summoning of Rudra,

original: rgyal ba bzang po dpal dga' mo //
analyzed: rgyal ba bzang po dpal dga' mo //
translated: Jayabhadra, Śrībhadra, Śrīmatī,🔽Varṣavahā, Priyamāṇā,🔽Jhaṭiti, Sarasvatī,

original: char 'bebs dang ni sdug ma dang // myur ba dang ni dbyangs can ma //🔽gtum dang 'bebs dang gang dang g-yo //
analyzed: char 'bebs dang ni sdug ma dang // myur ba dang ni dbyangs can ma // gtum dang 'bebs dang gang dang g-yo //
translated: Caṇḍī, Vāsinī, and Vāyuvegā.

original: 'di dag sprin rgyal brgyad po zhes //
analyzed: 'di dag sprin rgyal brgyad po zhes //
translated: These are the eight clouds, the kings.

original: mkha' 'gro ma dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
translated: The one who is united with the ḍākinīs,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
translated: the vajrasattva, the tathāgata,🔽the blessed one, the vajra holder,

original: bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs //
analyzed: bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs //
translated: has taught.🔽On a human skull with two holes and the name of the victim, draw two fire maṇḍalas with bovine bezoar and blood.

original: bud med gnyis kyi thod pa ming dang ldan pa la go ro tsa na dang / khrag gis me'i dkyil 'khor gnyis bris te me'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtshams rnams su yi ge kshum dang hr'i:bkod la /
analyzed: bud med gnyis kyi thod pa ming dang ldan pa la go ro tsa na dang / khrag gis me'i dkyil 'khor gnyis bris te me'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtshams rnams su yi ge kshum dang hr'i:bkod la /
translated: In the corners of the fire maṇḍalas, place the syllables kṣuṃ and hriḥ.🔽In the center, write the name of the victim and surround it with three lines.

original: dbus su bsgrub bya'i ming bris te ri mo gsum gyis bskor nas mo dza'i sa bon nam /
analyzed: dbus su bsgrub bya'i ming bris te ri mo gsum gyis bskor nas mo dza'i sa bon nam /
translated: Surround the maṇḍala with the mo ja seed syllables or the syllable re pha.🔽Know the distinctions of the top and bottom of the skull.

original: re phas dkyil 'khor @340b gsum rim du bskor ti thod pa'i steng 'og gi bye brag shes par byas la seng ldeng gi me la dus gsum du bsros na /
analyzed: re phas dkyil 'khor @340b gsum rim du bskor ti thod pa'i steng 'og gi bye brag shes par byas la seng ldeng gi me la dus gsum du bsros na /
translated: If one heats it in a khadira fire three times,

original: phyi de nyin par 'ong ba'am bskam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi de nyin par 'ong ba'am bskam par 'gyur ro //
translated: The next day, it will come or dry up.

original: gnas dben pa'i sa phyogs su bla gab med par rdo rje sems dpa'i sku gzugs mar nag tsha bas byugs //
analyzed: gnas dben pa'i sa phyogs su bla gab med par rdo rje sems dpa'i sku gzugs mar nag tsha bas byugs //
translated: In an isolated place, in the open air, one should anoint an image of Vajrasattva with hot oil.

original: de shing steg mdzes pa la bzhag la /
analyzed: de shing steg mdzes pa la bzhag la /
translated: Placing it on a beautiful stand,🔽having offered a bath, and having dried it, one should visualize the descent of rain together with a partner in practice, and, facing upward, one should recite the mantra. If it does not rain, one should recite the mantra of glorious Vajrapāṇi.🔽If it does not rain, one should recite the mantra of glorious Vajrapāṇi.🔽If it does not rain, one should recite the mantra of glorious Vajrapāṇi.🔽If it does not rain, one should recite the mantra of glorious Vajrapāṇi.

original: khrus chab gsol nas bskams te sgrub pa'i grogs dang bcas par char dbab par dmigs nas kha shar stod du bltas la sngags bzlas na brgyad byin gyis char 'bebs so //
analyzed: khrus chab gsol nas bskams te sgrub pa'i grogs dang bcas par char dbab par dmigs nas kha shar stod du bltas la sngags bzlas na brgyad byin gyis char 'bebs so //

analyzed: min na dpal phyag na rdo rje'i sngags dang spel te bzlas na rgyun mi 'chad par 'bab bo // yang na kham phor la sbrul mgo gnyis pa'i sha dang / khrag gis snga ma ltar bris te /
translated: If it does not rain, one should recite the mantra of glorious Vajrapāṇi.🔽If it does not rain, one should recite the mantra of glorious Vajrapāṇi.🔽If it does not rain, one should recite the mantra of glorious Vajrapāṇi.🔽If it does not rain, one should recite the mantra of glorious Vajrapāṇi.🔽If it does not rain, one should recite the mantra of glorious Vajrapāṇi.🔽If it does not rain, one should recite the mantra of glorious Vajrapāṇi.🔽If it does not rain, one should recite the mantra of glorious Vajrapāṇi.🔽If it does not rain, one should recite the mantra of glorious Vajrapāṇi.🔽If it does not rain, one should recite the mantra of glorious Vajrapāṇi.🔽If it does not rain, one should recite the mantra of glorious Vajrapāṇi.

original: me lces ma reg par nam mkha' la bzhag la char dbab pa la sngags bzlas na 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me lces ma reg par nam mkha' la bzhag la char dbab pa la sngags bzlas na 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not rain, one should recite the mantra

original: char gcod par 'dod na rdo rje can la phul ba'i me tog gi bdug pa khang steng du gnas te gcer bur byung la sprin la bdugs shing sngags bzlas na bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: char gcod par 'dod na rdo rje can la phul ba'i me tog gi bdug pa khang steng du gnas te gcer bur byung la sprin la bdugs shing sngags bzlas na bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one wishes to stop rain, one should burn the flowers offered to the vajra-holder in a house on the roof, naked, and fumigate the clouds with the mantra.

original: kham phor so ma btang ba la /
analyzed: kham phor so ma btang ba la /
translated: On an unbaked clay pot,

original: dug la sogs pas rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gsum bris te de'i sa bon las gyur par bsam la /
analyzed: dug la sogs pas rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gsum bris te de'i sa bon las gyur par bsam la /
translated: one should draw the three maṇḍalas of wind, etc. with poison, etc., and imagine them to be the seed syllables.

original: chu'i steng du yang padma 'dab brgyad bris nas lte ba la h'um gnyis kyis gzir ba'i n'a bri /
analyzed: chu'i steng du yang padma 'dab brgyad bris nas lte ba la h'um gnyis kyis gzir ba'i n'a bri /
translated: On the surface of the water, one should also draw an eight-petaled lotus, and in the center, write NA with two HUMs pressing down on it.

original: 'dab ma brgyad la yang klu brgyad kyi snying po gzir ba @341a *//
analyzed: 'dab ma brgyad la yang klu brgyad kyi snying po gzir ba @341a *//
translated: On the eight petals, one should also write the essence mantras of the eight nāgas, pressed down with

original: bris la stobs po che'i sngags dang / h'um dgus chog bzhin du mtsho skyes bskor te sngags bzlas shing ji ltar 'byung ba bzhin du mchod pa byas la /
analyzed: bris la stobs po che'i sngags dang / h'um dgus chog bzhin du mtsho skyes bskor te sngags bzlas shing ji ltar 'byung ba bzhin du mchod pa byas la /
translated: one should recite the mantra of Mahābala and the nine HUMs, encircle the lotus-born one, and make offerings as they occur.

original: kham phor kha sbyar te klu'i gnas su bcug na klu thams cad char gyi rgyun 'bebs so //
analyzed: kham phor kha sbyar te klu'i gnas su bcug na klu thams cad char gyi rgyun 'bebs so //
translated: If one joins the two halves of the clay pot and places it in the abode of the nāgas, all nāgas will cause a rain shower.

original: gal te des sdang ba'i klu rnams char mi 'babs na der sbyor ba 'di ltar bya ste /
analyzed: gal te des sdang ba'i klu rnams char mi 'babs na der sbyor ba 'di ltar bya ste /
translated: If the nāgas who are hostile to him do not cause rain to fall, he should perform this rite there.

original: gtum po'i sa bon la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la /
analyzed: gtum po'i sa bon la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la /
translated: He should recite the seed syllable of Caṇḍa eight hundred times.

original: klu'i mtshor sbyin sreg byas na char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: klu'i mtshor sbyin sreg byas na char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he performs a homa in the nāga lake, it will rain.

original: gal te des kyang char 'bab par ma gyur na /
analyzed: gal te des kyang char 'bab par ma gyur na /
translated: If it still does not rain,

original: de'i tshe yungs kar dang / tsha ba'i mar nag dang / sbrang rtsi dang / k'a ra b'i ra'i me tog rnams lhan cig phye mar byas te ril bu byas la /
analyzed: de'i tshe yungs kar dang / tsha ba'i mar nag dang / sbrang rtsi dang / k'a ra b'i ra'i me tog rnams lhan cig phye mar byas te ril bu byas la /
translated: then he should grind white mustard seed, hot oil, honey, and karavīra flowers together to make a paste.

original: de nyid la lan brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bzlas te klu'i mchor bcug na 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid la lan brgya rtsa brgyad mngon par bzlas te klu'i mchor bcug na 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: He should incant it eight hundred times and throw it into the nāga lake. It will rain.

original: gal te klu rnams sdang bas char mi 'bebs na mgo 'gags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te klu rnams sdang bas char mi 'bebs na mgo 'gags par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nāgas are hostile and do not cause rain to fall, their heads will split.

original: gal te yang mi 'bab na dur khrod kyi thal ba bzung ste rtsa ba'i skyur por spangs nas sngags bzlas te mtshor bcug na /
analyzed: gal te yang mi 'bab na dur khrod kyi thal ba bzung ste rtsa ba'i skyur por spangs nas sngags bzlas te mtshor bcug na /
translated: If it still does not rain, he should take charnel ground ash, mix it with the root of sour grass, recite the mantra, and throw it into the lake.

original: klu rnams myos shing char gyi rgyun 'bebs so //
analyzed: klu rnams myos shing char gyi rgyun 'bebs so //
translated: The nāgas will become crazed and cause a downpour of rain.

original: ci ste des kyang ma babs na padma dang autpa la sngon po dang / ba bla dang / zangs kyi phye ma dang / yungs kar dang / dbang po'i lag pa dang / pa la sha rnams las ril bu rgya shugs kyi 'bru gu tsam byas la /
analyzed: ci ste des kyang ma babs na padma dang autpa la sngon po dang / ba bla dang / zangs kyi phye ma dang / yungs kar dang / dbang po'i lag pa dang / pa la sha rnams las ril bu rgya shugs kyi 'bru gu tsam byas la /
translated: sesame, copper filings, white mustard seed, Indra’s staff, and palasha wood, the size of a jujube seed.

original: ril bu re re zhing lan bdun 'dun mngon par bsngags te ji srid char 'bab kyi bar du ril bu rnams mchor bskyur na /
analyzed: ril bu re re zhing lan bdun 'dun mngon par bsngags te ji srid char 'bab kyi bar du ril bu rnams mchor bskyur na /
translated: Recite the mantra over each pill seven times, and as long as it rains, throw the pills into the fire.

original: @341b nyin mo dang mtshan mo bye brag med par char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @341b nyin mo dang mtshan mo bye brag med par char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: The rain will fall day and night without distinction.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa chen pos sngags kyi rgyal po 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa chen pos sngags kyi rgyal po 'di gsungs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Great Vajra Holder, spoke this king of mantras:

original: aom na mo n'i l'amba ra dha r'a ya; badzra p'a na ye /
analyzed: aom na mo n'i l'amba ra dha r'a ya; badzra p'a na ye /
translated: “Oṃ, homage to Nīlāmbara­dhara, Vajrapāṇi,

original: mah'a yaksha se n'a pa ta ye /
analyzed: mah'a yaksha se n'a pa ta ye /
translated: Lord of the Great Yakṣa Assembly,

original: aa ne ka gam g'a na d'i b'a la ko sa ma buddha ko ti /🔽sha ta sa ha sra pa ri britt'a ya /
analyzed: aa ne ka gam g'a na d'i b'a la ko sa ma buddha ko ti / sha ta sa ha sra pa ri britt'a ya /
translated: With your many terrifying roars,🔽You who have practiced for a hundred thousand years,

analyzed: bi kri tam damshta /

original: k'a la r'u p'a ya /
analyzed: k'a la r'u p'a ya /

analyzed: aakni ra si /

analyzed: na y'a na y'a /

translated: sarvavidyāvināśakārakāya phaṭ

original: n'i l'a mba ra dha ro badzra p'a ni r'a dzny'a pa ya ti sv'a h'a /
analyzed: n'i l'a mba ra dha ro badzra p'a ni r'a dzny'a pa ya ti sv'a h'a /
translated: nīlāmbaradhara vajrapāṇirājño’vadātaḥ svāhā

original: gnod sbyin dang srin po la sogs pas zin pa la ni chu la bzlas te gtor na grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod sbyin dang srin po la sogs pas zin pa la ni chu la bzlas te gtor na grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one sprinkles water enchanted with this mantra on someone seized by a yakṣa, rākṣasa, or the like, they will be freed.

original: char bzlog pa la ni thal ba la bzlas nas sprin la bltas te gtor bar bya'o //
analyzed: char bzlog pa la ni thal ba la bzlas nas sprin la bltas te gtor bar bya'o //
translated: For averting rain, one should recite over ashes and scatter them while looking at the clouds.

original: chu la bzlas te gtor na ni char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu la bzlas te gtor na ni char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one scatters [the ashes] while reciting over water, it will rain.

original: rims la ni skud pa sngon po la bzlas te lag pa la btags na grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rims la ni skud pa sngon po la bzlas te lag pa la btags na grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For a fever, one should recite over a blue thread and tie it to the arm; [the patient] will be freed.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma gzas zin pa'i dus su go ro tsa na la lan stong mngon par bzlas te dpral bar thig ler byas na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
