analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma gzas zin pa'i dus su go ro tsa na la lan stong mngon par bzlas te dpral bar thig ler byas na mi snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At the time of an eclipse of the moon or sun, one should incant gorochana one thousand times and make a bindu on the forehead; one will become invisible.

original: don la dmigs @342b te gtsang zhing gtsang ba'i gos gyon la nyin mtshan du kun tu ru bsregs te lan brgyad brgya bzlas na /
analyzed: don la dmigs @342b te gtsang zhing gtsang ba'i gos gyon la nyin mtshan du kun tu ru bsregs te lan brgyad brgya bzlas na /
translated: One should focus on the goal, wear clean clothes, and burn agalloch continuously day and night. Recite [the mantra] eight hundred times.

original: rmi lam du dge sdig thams cad ston bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmi lam du dge sdig thams cad ston bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In a dream, all virtues and sins will be revealed.

original: sa la lan bdun bzlas te chom po la bltas nas bus na /
analyzed: sa la lan bdun bzlas te chom po la bltas nas bus na /
translated: One should recite over the earth seven times, blow on a thief, and look at him.

original: chom po bas mi mthong zhing bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chom po bas mi mthong zhing bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The thief will not be seen and will be averted.

original: me tog gam 'bras bu la lan bdun bzlas te gang la phyin pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me tog gam 'bras bu la lan bdun bzlas te gang la phyin pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites over a flower or fruit seven times and gives it to someone, they will become enthralled.

original: zhes / mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
analyzed: zhes / mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
translated: Thus,

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog /
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog /
translated: the Vajra Dakini, the supreme bliss of union with all dakinis,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
translated: the Tathagata Vajrasattva,

original: bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs //
analyzed: bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs //
translated: the Blessed One with the vajra, has spoken.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro las /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro las /
translated: From the great king of tantras, the glorious Vajradaka,

original: klu thams cad 'gugs pa'i rim par phye ba ste gsum pa'o ////
analyzed: klu thams cad 'gugs pa'i rim par phye ba ste gsum pa'o ////
translated: the third chapter on the process of summoning all nagas.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha mo rnams kyis slar yang mchod pas mchod cing phyag gsum byas te 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha mo rnams kyis slar yang mchod pas mchod cing phyag gsum byas te 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the goddesses again made offerings to the Blessed One, prostrated three times, and said this:

original: las thams cad kyi tshogs bcom ldan 'das lha yis bshad du gsol /
analyzed: las thams cad kyi tshogs bcom ldan 'das lha yis bshad du gsol /
translated: Please explain to us, Blessed One, the collection of all activities.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rig pa'i rgyal po 'di mgur du bzhes te bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rig pa'i rgyal po 'di mgur du bzhes te bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, taking this king of awareness mantras to his throat, spoke:

original: ghi li ghi li barsha ya barsha ya badzra da ai ni sha pa ri sha pa aa /
analyzed: ghi li ghi li barsha ya barsha ya badzra da ai ni sha pa ri sha pa aa /
translated: Gili gili varshaya varshaya vajra dinish aparish apa!

original: h'um h'um h'um/ ho ho ho /
analyzed: h'um h'um h'um/ ho ho ho /
translated: Hum hum hum! Ho ho ho!

original: bu sa tha /🔽bu sa tha /
analyzed: bu sa tha / bu sa tha /
translated: Butsa tha!🔽Butsa tha!

original: bu sa tha /
analyzed: bu sa tha /
translated: Butsa tha!

original: ha sa ha sa /
analyzed: ha sa ha sa /
translated: Hasa hasa!

original: ha ha / aom ni zla phyed thig les brgyan //
analyzed: ha ha / aom ni zla phyed thig les brgyan //
translated: Om is adorned with the crescent moon drop.

original: de ni chu 'dzin brgyad la gnas //
analyzed: de ni chu 'dzin brgyad la gnas //
translated: It abides in the eight clouds.

original: mkha' 'gro ma yi rig sngags te //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma yi rig sngags te //
translated: This is the knowledge mantra of the dakinis,

original: sgyu mchen bo'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sgyu mchen bo'i rang bzhin no //
translated: the nature of the great illusion.

original: @343a *// 'di ni gsung ma thag tu yang //
analyzed: @343a *// 'di ni gsung ma thag tu yang //
translated: As soon as this is uttered,

original: klu rnams thams cad brgyal 'gyur zhes //
analyzed: klu rnams thams cad brgyal 'gyur zhes //
translated: all the nagas will faint.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
translated: Thus spoke Vajrasattva, the Tathagata,

original: bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs //
analyzed: bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs //
translated: the Blessed One, the Holder of the Vajra.

original: na ma: shma s'a na b'a si ni /
analyzed: na ma: shma s'a na b'a si ni /
translated: Namaḥ śam-sana-vāsinī

original: mah'a ka la /
analyzed: mah'a ka la /
translated: mahā-kala

original: aa nutstsha ya /
analyzed: aa nutstsha ya /
translated: anuccha-ya

original: ta dya th'a /
analyzed: ta dya th'a /
translated: tadyathā

original: aom tsa le tsa le pra tsa le /
analyzed: aom tsa le tsa le pra tsa le /
translated: oṃ cale cale pracale

original: la l'a la l'a ya /
analyzed: la l'a la l'a ya /
translated: lālā lālāya

original: de bi lam ga sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de bi lam ga sv'a h'a /
translated: devī laṅgā svāhā

original: sngags 'di bsnyen pa khri byas te mtshan phyed na ling'i drung du ji srid 'ongs kyi bar du bzlas pa byas te gong bu dgug pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: sngags 'di bsnyen pa khri byas te mtshan phyed na ling'i drung du ji srid 'ongs kyi bar du bzlas pa byas te gong bu dgug pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Having recited this mantra ten thousand times, at midnight in front of the liṅga, one should recite it until it arrives. This is the ritual for summoning the lump.

original: aom tsa mu nde dh'u ma ke shi ba dhu dze he /
analyzed: aom tsa mu nde dh'u ma ke shi ba dhu dze he /
translated: Oṃ ca-munideva-dhūma-keśi-vadhu-je he

original: bhe ha na ha na /
analyzed: bhe ha na ha na /
translated: bhe hana hana

original: da ha da ha /
analyzed: da ha da ha /
translated: dhaha dhaha

original: pa ca pa tsa /
analyzed: pa ca pa tsa /
translated: pacha pacha

original: de pa danta m'a ra ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de pa danta m'a ra ya sv'a h'a /
translated: depa-danta-mārāya svāhā

original: rang gi rkang mthil g-yon par sen rtsis ri rab bris la /
analyzed: rang gi rkang mthil g-yon par sen rtsis ri rab bris la /
translated: Draw with one's nail a mountain Meru on the left sole of the foot,

original: de'i nang rol gyi gra bzhir yi ga hr'i: bzhi bri /
analyzed: de'i nang rol gyi gra bzhir yi ga hr'i: bzhi bri /
translated: and in the four corners inside of it draw the four syllables ga hri.

original: dbus su sngags kyi chig bris la //
analyzed: dbus su sngags kyi chig bris la //
translated: In the middle write the mantra once.

original: rdog pas mnan te bzlas na khugs shing dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdog pas mnan te bzlas na khugs shing dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites while pressing down with the heel, [the victim] will be summoned and will come under one's control.

original: skyes bu'i byin pa g-yon pa'i rus pa'i thur ma la steng gi char tshogs kyi dbang phyug phyag bzhi pa /
analyzed: skyes bu'i byin pa g-yon pa'i rus pa'i thur ma la steng gi char tshogs kyi dbang phyug phyag bzhi pa /
translated: On the left thighbone of a man make a four-armed Gaṇapati,

original: zhal 'og tu gzigs pa /
analyzed: zhal 'og tu gzigs pa /
translated: with a face looking downward,

original: lag pa g-yas pa dang / g-yon par tho ba dang / dgra sta dang / zhags pa dang / mdung rtse gsum pa bsnams pa byas la /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa dang / g-yon par tho ba dang / dgra sta dang / zhags pa dang / mdung rtse gsum pa bsnams pa byas la /
translated: holding a hammer and an axe in the right hands, and a noose and a trident in the left hands.🔽Make a dagger out of poison, blood, black mustard seed, salt, and bitter wood,

original: dug dang / khrag dang / ske tshe dang / lan tsha dang / lce myang tshar bcas pa'i mar nag gi nang du phur bu de btsos te stobs po che'i sngags bzlas la /
analyzed: dug dang / khrag dang / ske tshe dang / lan tsha dang / lce myang tshar bcas pa'i mar nag gi nang du phur bu de btsos te stobs po che'i sngags bzlas la /
translated: and cook it in black mustard oil.

original: gang gi khyim sgor spas pa de la gcong @343b nad chen po 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi khyim sgor spas pa de la gcong @343b nad chen po 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: If one buries it at the door of the house of someone, he will get a serious illness.

original: bton na thar par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bton na thar par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is removed, [the victim] will be freed.

original: aom badzra kro dha ma h'a ba la ha na da ha ba tsa /
analyzed: aom badzra kro dha ma h'a ba la ha na da ha ba tsa /
translated: Oṃ vajra-krodha mahā-bala hana daha pacha

original: bi dhvam sa ya autsh'a d'a ya m'a ra ya h'um phat/
analyzed: bi dhvam sa ya autsh'a d'a ya m'a ra ya h'um phat/
translated: vidhvaṃsaya utsādaya māraya hūṃ phaṭ.

original: grog mkhar gyi sa dang ba'i rnam lngar bcas pas klu b'a su ki'i gzugs brnyan mtho gang tsam pa byas te k'a ra b'i ra'i lcug mas bkab la /
analyzed: grog mkhar gyi sa dang ba'i rnam lngar bcas pas klu b'a su ki'i gzugs brnyan mtho gang tsam pa byas te k'a ra b'i ra'i lcug mas bkab la /
translated: Make an effigy of the nāga Vāsuki from anthill clay and the five products of a cow, one cubit tall, covered with kāravīra twigs.

original: gu gul gyi bdug pa rgyun mi 'chad par bdug cing dkar gsum gyi gtor ma byin la /
analyzed: gu gul gyi bdug pa rgyun mi 'chad par bdug cing dkar gsum gyi gtor ma byin la /
translated: Make continuous incense offerings of gugul, and give a bali of the three white foods.

original: k'a ra b'i ra'i lcug mas rgyun mi 'chad par chu gtor zhing bzlas na /
analyzed: k'a ra b'i ra'i lcug mas rgyun mi 'chad par chu gtor zhing bzlas na /
translated: If you continuously offer water with kāravīra twigs,

original: zhag bdun gyis char gyi rgyun 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: zhag bdun gyis char gyi rgyun 'bebs par byed do //
translated: after seven days he will cause a rain to fall.

original: ji ste bab par ma gyur na /
analyzed: ji ste bab par ma gyur na /
translated: If it does not rain,

original: nyi ma bdun pa la dum bu dum bur byas te bum pa'i nang du blugs la /
analyzed: nyi ma bdun pa la dum bu dum bur byas te bum pa'i nang du blugs la /
translated: on the seventh day cut the effigy into pieces and put it in a vase.

original: h'um bzhi pa'i sngags bzlas shing chu bo chen por bskur na nges par bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: h'um bzhi pa'i sngags bzlas shing chu bo chen por bskur na nges par bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: Recite the mantra of the four hūṃs and cast it into a great river. It will definitely rain.

original: aom ga ga aa ri ga ga sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ga ga aa ri ga ga sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ gagāri gaga svāhā.

original: sngags 'di nang bar sngar gdong ma bkrus par rde'u la lan bdun bzlas te gang yang rung ba'i bu gar bcug la /
analyzed: sngags 'di nang bar sngar gdong ma bkrus par rde'u la lan bdun bzlas te gang yang rung ba'i bu gar bcug la /
translated: If one recites this mantra seven times over a stone and inserts it into any hole,

original: che ge mo'i kha chings shig ces brjod na kha chings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: che ge mo'i kha chings shig ces brjod na kha chings par 'gyur ro //
translated: and says, “So-and-so’s mouth is sealed,” then the mouth will be sealed.

original: mu kha ti shtham ti mu ka gatstsha ti /
analyzed: mu kha ti shtham ti mu ka gatstsha ti /
translated: mukhasthāṃ mukhacchatam |

original: mu kha dam ta lam ga lam mu ka na mu dra pu ri sha na /
analyzed: mu kha dam ta lam ga lam mu ka na mu dra pu ri sha na /
translated: mukhaṃ talāṅgalaṃ mukhaṃ nadīpurīśaṇaṃ |

original: de ba datta sya mu kha bam dh'a mi sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de ba datta sya mu kha bam dh'a mi sv'a h'a /
translated: devadatta-syamukhaṃ badhāmi svāhā |

original: glang gi lci ba sa la ma ltung ba byi ba'i khung bu sgo gnam du bltas pa'i nang du bcug la bzlas shing kha chings shig ces brjod na /
analyzed: glang gi lci ba sa la ma ltung ba byi ba'i khung bu sgo gnam du bltas pa'i nang du bcug la bzlas shing kha chings shig ces brjod na /
translated: One should insert into a rat hole in the ground, not fallen on the ground, cow dung, and recite, “Seal the mouth!”

original: rgyal po'i pho brang la sogs pa dang / @344a *//
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang la sogs pa dang / @344a *//
translated: If one recites this over a king’s palace, etc.,

original: shags 'gyed pa la bzlas pa tsam gyis kha bcings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shags 'gyed pa la bzlas pa tsam gyis kha bcings par 'gyur ro //
translated: and over a debate, the mouth will be sealed by mere recitation.

original: aa k'a ro mu kham thog mar sbyar //
analyzed: aa k'a ro mu kham thog mar sbyar //
translated: “Akāra oṃkāra at the beginning,

original: sarba dharm'a nam de mthar //🔽rab tu sbyar te slar yang ni //
analyzed: sarba dharm'a nam de mthar // rab tu sbyar te slar yang ni //
translated: sarvadharmāṇāṃ at the end,🔽and again

original: a'adya nud pannta tv'a ta ces bya //
analyzed: a'adya nud pannta tv'a ta ces bya //
translated: ādya nuḍa pañcatā tvaṃ.”

original: sngon du gsungs pa'i sbyor ba yang //
analyzed: sngon du gsungs pa'i sbyor ba yang //
translated: The previously mentioned practice

original: blo gros chen mo mdun gnas te //
analyzed: blo gros chen mo mdun gnas te //
translated: is in front of the great-minded one.

original: sngags 'di bdun ni brjod bya na //
analyzed: sngags 'di bdun ni brjod bya na //
translated: The mantra is to be recited seven times.

original: mkhar gnas rnams kyis nges par ni //
analyzed: mkhar gnas rnams kyis nges par ni //
translated: The rain-dwelling ones will certainly

original: chu ni rab tu mang po 'bebs //
analyzed: chu ni rab tu mang po 'bebs //
translated: send down a great deal of water.

original: sde tshan tha ma ra'i stan la gnas pa la /
analyzed: sde tshan tha ma ra'i stan la gnas pa la /
translated: The last group is based on the seat of Ra.

original: dbyangs yig bzhi pa dang ni thig les brgyan te /
analyzed: dbyangs yig bzhi pa dang ni thig les brgyan te /
translated: It is adorned with the fourth vowel [u] and a visarga.

original: tsandan dmar pos nyal ba'i sngags kyis gzhi la byugs te der rang gi khrag gis snying po la ming bris la /
analyzed: tsandan dmar pos nyal ba'i sngags kyis gzhi la byugs te der rang gi khrag gis snying po la ming bris la /
translated: Anoint the bed with the mantra of red sandalwood. Write the name of the target in the center with one's own blood.

original: nyal ba'i dus su me tog dmar pos gtor zhing bdug pas bdugs na; rang gi bud med chags pas mi phyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyal ba'i dus su me tog dmar pos gtor zhing bdug pas bdugs na; rang gi bud med chags pas mi phyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: When going to bed, scatter red flowers and burn incense. One's own woman will be inseparable due to passion.

original: snying gar nyi ma la h'um bsgoms te bdag nyid khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba la sogs par bsgoms la //
analyzed: snying gar nyi ma la h'um bsgoms te bdag nyid khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba la sogs par bsgoms la //
translated: Meditate on HŪṂ on the sun in the heart, and meditate on oneself as Trailokyavijaya, and so forth.

original: rdo rje so can gyi khrag gis shing dza ta'i lcug ma'i smyug gus ras sam /
analyzed: rdo rje so can gyi khrag gis shing dza ta'i lcug ma'i smyug gus ras sam /
translated: With a brush made of twigs of the jasmine tree soaked in the blood of a vajra-possessor, on cloth or birch bark,

original: gro ga la rlung gi sa bon gyi dbus su bsgrub bya'i ming dang bskul tshig tu bcas pa /
analyzed: gro ga la rlung gi sa bon gyi dbus su bsgrub bya'i ming dang bskul tshig tu bcas pa /
translated: On a birch bark leaf, in the middle of a wind maṇḍala, write the name of the victim together with the incantation.🔽In the middle of two seeds, hūṃ and taṃ, write the name of the victim together with the incantation.

original: h'um takki zhes bya ba'i sa bon gnyis kyi dbus su bris la lcags kyu la sogs pas dgugs pa la sogs pa'i las byas te so phag gi dbus su bcug la /
analyzed: h'um takki zhes bya ba'i sa bon gnyis kyi dbus su bris la lcags kyu la sogs pas dgugs pa la sogs pa'i las byas te so phag gi dbus su bcug la /
translated: Having performed the rite of summoning with the iron hook, and so on, place it in the middle of a brick.

original: skud pa dmar pos dkris nas @344b rlung mtshams su g-yon brkyang gi rkang pas mnan te bzlas na /
analyzed: skud pa dmar pos dkris nas @344b rlung mtshams su g-yon brkyang gi rkang pas mnan te bzlas na /
translated: Having wrapped it with red thread, step on it with the left foot in the southwest, and recite.

original: rgya mtsho la thug gis gzhi thams cad du 'khyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgya mtsho la thug gis gzhi thams cad du 'khyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: [The victim] will wander everywhere on the earth as far as the ocean.

original: bton nas 'o mas bkrus na grol bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bton nas 'o mas bkrus na grol bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If [the victim] is released and washed with milk, [the victim] will be freed.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: [The victim] will not be freed otherwise.

original: bdag nyid mam dmar po las bud med kyi gzugs su bskyed de aom dmar po sbyi bor yang bsam la /
analyzed: bdag nyid mam dmar po las bud med kyi gzugs su bskyed de aom dmar po sbyi bor yang bsam la /
translated: From a red maṃ, generate a female form, and imagine a red oṃ at the crown.

original: bu mo'i kha nas bdag gi khar sngags kyi phreng ba cho ga bzhin du zhugs par bsam na dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bu mo'i kha nas bdag gi khar sngags kyi phreng ba cho ga bzhin du zhugs par bsam na dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one imagines that the mantra rosary enters one’s mouth from the mouth of the girl according to the rite, [the girl] will be enthralled.

original: bud med kyi gci ba'i shul gyis dang / rang gi gci ba'i shul gyi sa las mo mtshan gyi gzugs byas te de'i steng du rang gi mtshan ma bzhag la sngags lan bdun bzlas nas der gci ba'i las byas la /
analyzed: bud med kyi gci ba'i shul gyis dang / rang gi gci ba'i shul gyi sa las mo mtshan gyi gzugs byas te de'i steng du rang gi mtshan ma bzhag la sngags lan bdun bzlas nas der gci ba'i las byas la /
translated: Recite the mantra seven times and perform the act of urination there.

original: nyi ma bdun du dus gsum du sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na /
analyzed: nyi ma bdun du dus gsum du sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas na /
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred and eight times three times a day for seven days,

original: brgya byin gyi chung ma yang 'ong bar 'gyur na gzhan rnams lta ci smos //
analyzed: brgya byin gyi chung ma yang 'ong bar 'gyur na gzhan rnams lta ci smos //
translated: even Śakra’s wife will come, let alone others.

original: skyes pa'i thod par go ro tsa na dang sen rtsis bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan bris te snying gar ming dang spel ba'i sngags bris la /
analyzed: skyes pa'i thod par go ro tsa na dang sen rtsis bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan bris te snying gar ming dang spel ba'i sngags bris la /
translated: Draw the effigy of the victim with bovine bezoar and fingernail parings on a human skull.

original: dri chus byugs nas thod pa gnyis kha sbyar zhing ro'i skud pas kun tu dkris te spra tshil gyis byugs la /
analyzed: dri chus byugs nas thod pa gnyis kha sbyar zhing ro'i skud pas kun tu dkris te spra tshil gyis byugs la /
translated: Smear it with urine, join the two skulls, wrap it completely with charnel ground string, and smear it with beeswax.

original: ro bsregs pa'i sol ba'i me la ji srid spra tshil zhu bar ma gyur gyi bar du rig pa'i rgyal po 'di zlos shing gdungs na /
analyzed: ro bsregs pa'i sol ba'i me la ji srid spra tshil zhu bar ma gyur gyi bar du rig pa'i rgyal po 'di zlos shing gdungs na /
translated: While reciting this king of awareness mantras, heat it over a fire of charnel ground wood until the beeswax melts.

original: las kyi chog de lta bus lha'i 'jig rten yang 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kyi chog de lta bus lha'i 'jig rten yang 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By such rites, one can even summon the world of the gods.

original: dug can gyi thod par gnod spyin smyon pa'i lca bcug la /
analyzed: dug can gyi thod par gnod spyin smyon pa'i lca bcug la /
translated: Place a mad yakṣa’s hair in a skull cup that contains poison,

original: rta'i rmig pa'i @345a *//
analyzed: rta'i rmig pa'i @345a *//
translated: and insert it into the hoof of a horse.

original: ser khar bcug ste gang gi khyim sgor spas ba de nyi ma bdun gyis bskrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ser khar bcug ste gang gi khyim sgor spas ba de nyi ma bdun gyis bskrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever’s door it is placed at will be expelled in seven days.

original: yang na las kyi dus su kha zas kyi phud kyi chang bu la sngags lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te khro ba dang bcas pas bsgrub byar gzhug ste nyi ma bdun gyis bskrad phar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na las kyi dus su kha zas kyi phud kyi chang bu la sngags lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te khro ba dang bcas pas bsgrub byar gzhug ste nyi ma bdun gyis bskrad phar 'gyur ro //
translated: Alternatively, at the time of the rite, incant the first portion of food with the mantra one hundred and eight times, and give it to the victim with anger. He will be expelled in seven days.

original: lci ba sa lam lhung ba la bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan sor bcu drug pa'am /
analyzed: lci ba sa lam lhung ba la bsgrub bya'i gzugs brnyan sor bcu drug pa'am /
translated: Make an effigy of the victim out of clay from an anthill, sixteen digits long,

original: phyed dang bcu gsum pa byas la /🔽ras mi 'du ma bu la de'i ming bris te ltor bcug la /
analyzed: phyed dang bcu gsum pa byas la / ras mi 'du ma bu la de'i ming bris te ltor bcug la /
translated: or thirteen and a half digits long.🔽Write his name on a piece of cotton cloth, and insert it into the effigy.

original: bag zan gyis de'i kha bkang ste ro skras dkris la /
analyzed: bag zan gyis de'i kha bkang ste ro skras dkris la /
translated: Fill its mouth with dough, and wrap it in the hair of a corpse.

original: gtun shing la sngags lan bdun bzlas te khro bo dang bcas pas da'i gdong btsegs na bcings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtun shing la sngags lan bdun bzlas te khro bo dang bcas pas da'i gdong btsegs na bcings par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having enchanted a pestle seven times, one should, with wrath, plant it in the ground in front of the girl.

original: dpa' bo g-yul du bsad pa'i ras la bu mo'i gzugs brnyan ri mor bris te ba glang gi rdul dang / shing pu ba ta la'i rtsa ba'i bdug pas bdugs na bu mo de 'ong bar 'gyur ro //🔽ras sam / gro ga'am /
analyzed: dpa' bo g-yul du bsad pa'i ras la bu mo'i gzugs brnyan ri mor bris te ba glang gi rdul dang / shing pu ba ta la'i rtsa ba'i bdug pas bdugs na bu mo de 'ong bar 'gyur ro // ras sam / gro ga'am /
translated: Having drawn the image of a girl on a cloth from a hero killed in battle, and having fumigated it with the smoke of cow dung and the root of the puṣpa tree, that girl will come.🔽on cloth, or

original: spang leb bam /
analyzed: spang leb bam /
translated: on birch bark,

original: rtsig ngos la khro bo gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs kha dog thams cad dang ldan pa g-yas brkyang bas gnas pa /
analyzed: rtsig ngos la khro bo gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs kha dog thams cad dang ldan pa g-yas brkyang bas gnas pa /
translated: or on a wall, the form of the wrathful Yamantaka, endowed with all the colors, standing with the right leg extended,

original: lag pa g-yas na tho ba /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas na tho ba /
translated: holding a hammer in the right hand,

original: g-yon na sprul zhags 'dzin cing khro gnyer dang / smin ma bcum pa /
analyzed: g-yon na sprul zhags 'dzin cing khro gnyer dang / smin ma bcum pa /
translated: holding a snake-lasso in the left hand, with a frown and furrowed brow,

original: mche ba gtsigs shing spyan dmar ba /
analyzed: mche ba gtsigs shing spyan dmar ba /
translated: baring his fangs, with red eyes,

original: skra gyen du 'greng zhing sbrul gyis rgyan gyis brgyan pa 'od 'bar ba dang bcas pa bris la /
analyzed: skra gyen du 'greng zhing sbrul gyis rgyan gyis brgyan pa 'od 'bar ba dang bcas pa bris la /
translated: with hair standing upward, adorned with snake ornaments, blazing with light.

original: sbrul zhags kyi ltor dur khrod kyi sol bas dgra'i tshogs kyi ming sngags dang spel ba bris te @345b bzhag na /
analyzed: sbrul zhags kyi ltor dur khrod kyi sol bas dgra'i tshogs kyi ming sngags dang spel ba bris te @345b bzhag na /
translated: If one writes the name of the enemy's army with charnel ground ash on the belly of a snake,

original: ji srid gnas kyi bar du dgra rnams bcings par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji srid gnas kyi bar du dgra rnams bcings par 'gyur te /
translated: the enemy will be bound for as long as it remains.

original: tha na yid kyis kyang cung zad tsam yang gnod par sems par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha na yid kyis kyang cung zad tsam yang gnod par sems par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if they think of doing the slightest harm, they will not be able to do so.🔽If they think of doing harm, they will be harmed by bhūtas,

original: gal te gnod par sems na 'byung po dang; rims dang / gdon dang / sha za dang / mkha' 'gro mas nye bar 'tshe bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te gnod par sems na 'byung po dang; rims dang / gdon dang / sha za dang / mkha' 'gro mas nye bar 'tshe bar 'gyur la /
translated: epidemics, grahas, piśācas, and kinnaras.

original: lha rnams kyis kyang stor bar 'gyur ta /
analyzed: lha rnams kyis kyang stor bar 'gyur ta /
translated: Even the gods will destroy them.

original: pha rol gyi dpung gi tshig spel na dbung bcings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol gyi dpung gi tshig spel na dbung bcings par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one writes the name of the enemy's army, they will be bound.

original: gzhan yang shing lo la sogs pa la sngags phreng gnyis su bris te phreng gnyis pa'i mthar bsgrub bya'i ming gi yi ge dang spel te bris nas bcings la /
analyzed: gzhan yang shing lo la sogs pa la sngags phreng gnyis su bris te phreng gnyis pa'i mthar bsgrub bya'i ming gi yi ge dang spel te bris nas bcings la /
translated: Further, one should write the mantra string twice on a leaf, and so on, and write the name of the victim between the two strings.

original: kham phor du bzhag ste der bshang ba btang la /
analyzed: kham phor du bzhag ste der bshang ba btang la /
translated: Having bound it, one should place it in a clay pot and defecate into it.

original: ba glang gi lci skam gyi thal bas bkang ste kham phor kha sbyar la dbugs nang du rdub cing sa 'og tu spas nas sa'i 'thug pa kho nar bkab na /
analyzed: ba glang gi lci skam gyi thal bas bkang ste kham phor kha sbyar la dbugs nang du rdub cing sa 'og tu spas nas sa'i 'thug pa kho nar bkab na /
translated: Fill a joined pair of bowls with the ashes of a cow’s dung fire, and bury them in the ground, covering them with only a thin layer of earth.

original: dgra bcings par 'gyur ba las gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcings par 'gyur ba las gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: The enemy will be bound, and nothing else.

original: ratna badzra zhes byas nas //
analyzed: ratna badzra zhes byas nas //
translated: Having said “ratna vajra,”

original: de nas aom dang badzra brjod //
analyzed: de nas aom dang badzra brjod //
translated: then say “oṃ” and “vajra.”

original: hra'i dang phat ni mthar sbyar ba //
analyzed: hra'i dang phat ni mthar sbyar ba //
translated: At the end, add “hrīḥ” and “phaṭ.”

original: sngags 'di dpung ni 'ching byed yin //
analyzed: sngags 'di dpung ni 'ching byed yin //
translated: This mantra binds the army.

original: sa nag po la lha mo tsa munda'i gdong byas la /
analyzed: sa nag po la lha mo tsa munda'i gdong byas la /
translated: On black earth, make the face of goddess Cāmuṇḍā.

original: go ro tsa nas bsgrub bya du yod pa'i ming dang sbel ba'i sngags bris te de'i khar bcug la /
analyzed: go ro tsa nas bsgrub bya du yod pa'i ming dang sbel ba'i sngags bris te de'i khar bcug la /
translated: Write the name of the victim together with the mantra to be repeated, with vermillion, and place it under that.

original: de'i khar mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod cing khyim gyi phyogs gcig  tu bzhag la /
analyzed: de'i khar mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod cing khyim gyi phyogs gcig  tu bzhag la /
translated: Place it in one place in the house, and make offerings with the five offerings.

original: nyin gcig bzhin du mchod par byas na kha bcings shing dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyin gcig bzhin du mchod par byas na kha bcings shing dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you make offerings every day, the mouth will be bound and you will be under control.

original: kham phor la ldong ros kyis bud med kyi gzugs brnyan bris la /
analyzed: kham phor la ldong ros kyis bud med kyi gzugs brnyan bris la /
translated: On a bowl, draw with vermillion the image of a woman.

original: de'i bha ga @346a *//
analyzed: de'i bha ga @346a *//
translated: One should point with that finger at the bhaga of a woman,

original: mdzub mo btsugs te zla ba gzas zin nas ji srid grol gyi bar du sngags bzla ba'am /
analyzed: mdzub mo btsugs te zla ba gzas zin nas ji srid grol gyi bar du sngags bzla ba'am /
translated: and recite the mantra for as long as the moon is eclipsed, until it is released.🔽Or else, one should practice with the finger of a real woman,

original: yang na bud med dngos kyi bha gar yang rung ste de ltar bsgrubs pa'i mdzub mos des mdzub yogs tsam gyis bu mo thams cad 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na bud med dngos kyi bha gar yang rung ste de ltar bsgrubs pa'i mdzub mos des mdzub yogs tsam gyis bu mo thams cad 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and by merely pointing with that finger, all girls will come.

original: ni ma pa'i lo ma la dug dang / rang gi khrag dang / da du ra'i khu bas yi ge phu bri /
analyzed: ni ma pa'i lo ma la dug dang / rang gi khrag dang / da du ra'i khu bas yi ge phu bri /
translated: On a leaf of neem tree, one should write the syllable pha with poison, one’s own blood, and datura extract.

original: de'i dbus su bsgrub bya'i ming bris la /🔽bag zan nam /
analyzed: de'i dbus su bsgrub bya'i ming bris la / bag zan nam /
translated: In the middle of that, one should write the name of the target.🔽One should place it inside a ball of dough or flour,

original: zan gyi ril bu'i nang du bcug ste dgong mo bya rog chang du 'gro kham la zar bcug na nges par bskrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zan gyi ril bu'i nang du bcug ste dgong mo bya rog chang du 'gro kham la zar bcug na nges par bskrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and if one makes a crow eat it in the evening, it will certainly be driven away.

original: rtsig ngos sam spang leb la yi ge tha bri /
analyzed: rtsig ngos sam spang leb la yi ge tha bri /
translated: On a wall or a flat stone, one should write the syllable ta.

original: de'i nang du dbyangs kyi yi ges 'khor bar bri /
analyzed: de'i nang du dbyangs kyi yi ges 'khor bar bri /
translated: In the middle of that, one should write the vowels arranged in a circle.

original: de'i nang du pha bri /
analyzed: de'i nang du pha bri /
translated: In the middle of that, one should write the syllable pha.

original: de'i nang du ha bri /
analyzed: de'i nang du ha bri /
translated: In the middle of that, one should write the syllable ha.

original: ha'i nang du ka der bsgrub bya'i ming bris la /
analyzed: ha'i nang du ka der bsgrub bya'i ming bris la /
translated: In the middle of the ha, one should write the name of the target.

original: de kha bcad de bzhag na dbang du 'gyur zhing bcing bas bcings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kha bcad de bzhag na dbang du 'gyur zhing bcing bas bcings par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one decides on that and leaves it, one will be under control, and will be bound by the binding.

original: lte ba'i padma'i dbus su ming gi yi ge'am aa bsgoms te padma'i bsdu ba byas la /
analyzed: lte ba'i padma'i dbus su ming gi yi ge'am aa bsgoms te padma'i bsdu ba byas la /
translated: Having meditated on the syllable of the name or the syllable A in the center of the navel lotus, one should gather the lotus.

original: snying gi zhags pa bcings na srung bar 'gyur te; aa ni sems can thams cad kyi //
analyzed: snying gi zhags pa bcings na srung bar 'gyur te; aa ni sems can thams cad kyi //
translated: If one binds the heart-lasso, one will be protected.

original: rang gi phyag rgya rtags sa bon //
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya rtags sa bon //
translated: A is the seed syllable of the sign of one’s own seal.

original: srog srung la sogs don gyi phyir //
analyzed: srog srung la sogs don gyi phyir //
translated: For the sake of the meaning of protecting life, and so on,

original: stobs kyis yang dag bcing bar bya //
analyzed: stobs kyis yang dag bcing bar bya //
translated: one should bind it with force.

original: yang na rdo rje lte ba kha sbyor gyi nang du gangs kyi 'od lta bu'i yi ge aa bsam la /
analyzed: yang na rdo rje lte ba kha sbyor gyi nang du gangs kyi 'od lta bu'i yi ge aa bsam la /
translated: Or else, one should imagine the syllable A, like the light of snow, in the center of the joined vajra.

original: de'i mtha' gnyis su snying gi zhags pas bcings na yang srung ba'i dam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i mtha' gnyis su snying gi zhags pas bcings na yang srung ba'i dam par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one binds the heart-lasso around its two ends, one will have the best protection.

original: snying ga'i padma la gnas par yi @346b ge ba kha thur du bltas pa bsam la /
analyzed: snying ga'i padma la gnas par yi @346b ge ba kha thur du bltas pa bsam la /
translated: One should imagine the syllable A, facing downward, located in the heart lotus.

original: lte ba'i padmar yi ge aa nas kyi 'bru tshod tsam bsams te ba las ba'i 'o ma'i rgyun lta bu'i bdud rtsi'i chu rgyun 'bab pas aa la khrus chab gsol ba rtag tu bsam na /
analyzed: lte ba'i padmar yi ge aa nas kyi 'bru tshod tsam bsams te ba las ba'i 'o ma'i rgyun lta bu'i bdud rtsi'i chu rgyun 'bab pas aa la khrus chab gsol ba rtag tu bsam na /
translated: Visualize the syllable a in the navel lotus, the size of a mustard seed. Imagine that a stream of nectar flows from it like a stream of cow's milk, and that the syllable a is bathed with it.

original: padma kha sbyor gyi bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: padma kha sbyor gyi bsam gtan gyi sbyor ba 'dis ni /
translated: By this yoga of meditation on the lotus with the mouth closed,

original: lus brtan par 'gyur ba dang / srog srung ba la snying gar dbang bskur zhing rgyas pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus brtan par 'gyur ba dang / srog srung ba la snying gar dbang bskur zhing rgyas pa phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: the body becomes firm, and life is protected.

original: shing ta la'i 'dab ma la bsgrub bya'i ming gi yi ge ga dang spel ba /
analyzed: shing ta la'i 'dab ma la bsgrub bya'i ming gi yi ge ga dang spel ba /
translated: On a palm leaf, write the name of the person to be accomplished, together with the syllable ga,

original: thog ma dang tha mar aom kha sbyar ba'i ri mo bris la /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha mar aom kha sbyar ba'i ri mo bris la /
translated: at the beginning and end of which are the joined syllables oṃ.

original: ri mo de dur khrod kyi sol bas bkang nas bum pa la sogs pa'i nang du bcug ste spra tshil la sogs pas kha bcad la dbugs nang du rdub cing mi gtsang ba'i phung po'i nang du bcug na /
analyzed: ri mo de dur khrod kyi sol bas bkang nas bum pa la sogs pa'i nang du bcug ste spra tshil la sogs pas kha bcad la dbugs nang du rdub cing mi gtsang ba'i phung po'i nang du bcug na /
translated: Fill the drawing with charnel ground ash, place it in a vase, and so forth, cover it with beeswax, and so forth, and blow into it.

original: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba thams cad bcings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba thams cad bcings par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you place it in a heap of filth, all that moves and does not move will be bound.

original: shing aarka'i rtsa ba la tshogs kyi dbang phyug gi gzugs lag pa bzhi dang ldan pa byas te sa bon dang / dgug pa dang / dam tshig sbyin pa la sogs pa byas nas lan tshva dang / ma ri ci dang / bca' lga dang /
analyzed: shing aarka'i rtsa ba la tshogs kyi dbang phyug gi gzugs lag pa bzhi dang ldan pa byas te sa bon dang / dgug pa dang / dam tshig sbyin pa la sogs pa byas nas lan tshva dang / ma ri ci dang / bca' lga dang /
translated: Having made an image of Gaṇapati with four arms at the base of an arka tree, having performed the rites of seed, summoning, bestowing the pledge, and so on, he should anoint it well with salt, marika, ginger,

original: sngon po dang / ska tshe dang / spun pa dang / chu rnams kyis legs par byugs te nyi ma phyed na khyim gyi chu'i nang du ske man chad kha lhor bstan te bcug la /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ska tshe dang / spun pa dang / chu rnams kyis legs par byugs te nyi ma phyed na khyim gyi chu'i nang du ske man chad kha lhor bstan te bcug la /
translated: blue lotuses, sugarcane, barley, and water. At noon, he should place it in a pot of water in his house, with its neck submerged, facing south.

original: mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod de sngags pas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa lngas mchod de sngags pas 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having made offerings with the five offerings, the mantrin should say this:

original: khyod kyis bdag la sogs pa'i las 'di zhes bya ba byas na /
analyzed: khyod kyis bdag la sogs pa'i las 'di zhes bya ba byas na /
translated: “If you do this work for me and so on,

original: de nas ci nus pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i mchod pa khyod la sbyin no //
analyzed: de nas ci nus pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i mchod pa khyod la sbyin no //
translated: then I will give you an offering in accordance with my ability.”

original: @347a *// zhes brjod la nyi ma bdun gyi bar du bya'o //
analyzed: @347a *// zhes brjod la nyi ma bdun gyi bar du bya'o //
translated: Having said this, he should do it for seven days.

original: de nas bya ba byas pa dang / de nas bton la 'o mas bkru zhing ci nus pa'i mchod pa byin la bzod pa gsol bar bya'o; ;bum pa dri'i chus bkang ste rin po che dang / sman dang / 'bru dang ldan par byas shing stobs po che'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas nas mandal gru bzhi par byas pa'i steng du skyes bu'i gtso bo bzhag ste /
analyzed: de nas bya ba byas pa dang / de nas bton la 'o mas bkru zhing ci nus pa'i mchod pa byin la bzod pa gsol bar bya'o; ;bum pa dri'i chus bkang ste rin po che dang / sman dang / 'bru dang ldan par byas shing stobs po che'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas nas mandal gru bzhi par byas pa'i steng du skyes bu'i gtso bo bzhag ste /
translated: Then, having performed the rite, one should take it out, wash it with milk, make offerings to the best of one’s ability, and request forbearance.🔽Having filled a vase with perfumed water, having added jewels, medicine, and grain, and having recited the Mahābala mantra one hundred and eight times, one should place the principal person on top of a square maṇḍala.

original: bum pa des khrus byas la sngags de gro ga la go ro tsa nas bris nas gtsug phud la btags te /
analyzed: bum pa des khrus byas la sngags de gro ga la go ro tsa nas bris nas gtsug phud la btags te /
translated: Having bathed him with that vase, having written that mantra on birch bark with bovine bezoar, and having tied it to his topknot,

original: g-yul du zhugs na pha rol gyi dbung las rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yul du zhugs na pha rol gyi dbung las rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if he enters into battle, he will be victorious over the opposing army.

original: dur khrod kyi ras sam /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi ras sam /
translated: “One should take charnel ground cloth

original: aa ba dhu ti'i ras la dug dang / khrag dang / nim ba'i lo ma'i khu ba rnams kyis sngags kyi yi ge re re zhing bsgrub bya'i ming dang spel ba lugs las bzlog ste bris la bcings nas nya phor gyi nang du bcug ste sha za'i shing gi rtsa ba'i rlung mtshams su spas na ni /
analyzed: aa ba dhu ti'i ras la dug dang / khrag dang / nim ba'i lo ma'i khu ba rnams kyis sngags kyi yi ge re re zhing bsgrub bya'i ming dang spel ba lugs las bzlog ste bris la bcings nas nya phor gyi nang du bcug ste sha za'i shing gi rtsa ba'i rlung mtshams su spas na ni /
translated: On a cloth of Avadhūti, with poison, blood, and the juice of neem leaves, write each of the mantra syllables, alternating with the name of the victim, in reverse order. Having bound it, place it in a conch shell and bury it at the northeast corner of a śāla tree.

original: bskrad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bskrad par 'gyur la /
translated: If you do this, [the victim] will be expelled.

original: me mtshams su bzhag na ni /
analyzed: me mtshams su bzhag na ni /
translated: If you place it at the southeast corner,

original: phan tshun sdang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: phan tshun sdang bar 'gyur la /
translated: they will become mutually hostile.

original: bden bral gyi mtshams su gsang ste spas na ni /
analyzed: bden bral gyi mtshams su gsang ste spas na ni /
translated: If you bury it secretly at the southwest corner,

original: gsod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsod par 'gyur ro //
translated: they will be killed.

original: cho ga 'di nyid kyis rnal 'byor pas g-yul du zhugs na dpung bcings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cho ga 'di nyid kyis rnal 'byor pas g-yul du zhugs na dpung bcings par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this very rite, if the practitioner enters into battle, the army will be bound.

original: slar bzlog pa la ni /
analyzed: slar bzlog pa la ni /
translated: For the reversal,

original: bton la 'o mas bkru zhing /
analyzed: bton la 'o mas bkru zhing /
translated: take it out and wash it with milk.

original: skyes bu'i ming dang spel ba'i sngags lugs su 'byung bar bzlas so //
analyzed: skyes bu'i ming dang spel ba'i sngags lugs su 'byung bar bzlas so //
translated: Recite the mantra with the person’s name in the forward order.

original: ldong ros kyis rang @347b gi lag pa g-yon pa'i mthil la bsgrub bya'i gzugs bris la /
analyzed: ldong ros kyis rang @347b gi lag pa g-yon pa'i mthil la bsgrub bya'i gzugs bris la /
translated: With realgar, draw the form of the victim on the palm of your left hand.

original: me mar gyi rtse mo la bsros na dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me mar gyi rtse mo la bsros na dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one fumigates the tip of the lamp, he will be enthralled.

original: mandal byugs te /
analyzed: mandal byugs te /
translated: Having anointed a maṇḍala,

original: zan gyi chang bu la ming dang sngags bzlas nas dgong mo tshang du 'gro kha ma'i bya rog la byin na yang bskrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zan gyi chang bu la ming dang sngags bzlas nas dgong mo tshang du 'gro kha ma'i bya rog la byin na yang bskrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: one should give a mouthful of food to a crow in the evening, at the time of going to its nest, with the name and the mantra. He will be expelled.

original: bsgags nas bsad pa'i ro'i thag gu blangs la /
analyzed: bsgags nas bsad pa'i ro'i thag gu blangs la /
translated: One should take a rope from the corpse of one who was hanged.

original: dum bu gsum du byas te /
analyzed: dum bu gsum du byas te /
translated: Having made it into three pieces,

original: ro sreg pa'i shing phyed tshig pa blangs la srub shing byas nas dur khrod du shing gi khri 'khrog cing sgra dang bcas pa la 'dug ste /
analyzed: ro sreg pa'i shing phyed tshig pa blangs la srub shing byas nas dur khrod du shing gi khri 'khrog cing sgra dang bcas pa la 'dug ste /
translated: one should take half-burned wood from a funeral pyre, make a churning stick, and sit on a shaking, creaking wooden stool in a charnel ground.

original: thag gu des srub shing la btags nas /
analyzed: thag gu des srub shing la btags nas /
translated: Having tied the rope to the churning stick,

original: ro'i bum pa bcug ste /🔽des srub cing sngags bzlas na gang gi ming nas bzung ste /
analyzed: ro'i bum pa bcug ste / des srub cing sngags bzlas na gang gi ming nas bzung ste /
translated: one should insert the corpse pot.

original: bzlas pa de 'ong bar 'gyur ro //🔽yang tha mal pa'i rdo'am /
analyzed: bzlas pa de 'ong bar 'gyur ro // yang tha mal pa'i rdo'am /
translated: If one churns and repeats the mantra, whoever’s name one takes, he will come.🔽Again, one should make an image of a three-hooded king of the nāgas on an ordinary stone

original: brdar rdo la klu'i rgyal po gdengs ka gsum dang ldan pa'i gzugs byas la /
analyzed: brdar rdo la klu'i rgyal po gdengs ka gsum dang ldan pa'i gzugs byas la /
translated: or a whetstone.

original: rdza ma nag po'i nang du bzhag ste /
analyzed: rdza ma nag po'i nang du bzhag ste /
translated: Having placed it in a black clay pot,

original: sbrang rtsi dang 'bras yos kyi bo ga ling dang / dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dang / mar me dang / 'o thug la sogs pas mchod la /
analyzed: sbrang rtsi dang 'bras yos kyi bo ga ling dang / dri dang / me tog dang / bdug pa dang / mar me dang / 'o thug la sogs pas mchod la /
translated: One should worship with honey, parched grain, incense, flowers, incense, lamps, and milk-rice.

original: snod de nyid kyi nang du bzhag ste /
analyzed: snod de nyid kyi nang du bzhag ste /
translated: One should place the vessel in the same place.

original: ras gsar pas bkab la bcings nas rgya btab ste /
analyzed: ras gsar pas bkab la bcings nas rgya btab ste /
translated: One should cover it with a new cloth, bind it, and seal it.🔽Placing one’s hand on top of it, one should recite the mantra one thousand and eight times.

original: de'i steng du lag pa bzhag la stong rtsa brgyad bzlas nas shin tu gsang ste; grong khyer gyi dbus su spas na ji srid ma bton gyi bar du grong khyer de gnas par 'gyur ro //🔽grong khyer pa 'bros pa rnams dgug par 'dod na de nyid du mchod cing dus @348a *//
analyzed: de'i steng du lag pa bzhag la stong rtsa brgyad bzlas nas shin tu gsang ste; grong khyer gyi dbus su spas na ji srid ma bton gyi bar du grong khyer de gnas par 'gyur ro // grong khyer pa 'bros pa rnams dgug par 'dod na de nyid du mchod cing dus @348a *//
translated: If one buries it in the center of a city, the city will remain as long as it is not dug up.🔽If one wishes to summon the fleeing citizens, one should worship it there and recite the mantra three times a day.

original: gsum du sngags bzlas na 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum du sngags bzlas na 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will come.

original: grong khyer pa 'bros par rtsom pa la ni /
analyzed: grong khyer pa 'bros par rtsom pa la ni /
translated: If the citizens are about to flee,

original: bu ram la bzlas te bza' bar byin na mi 'bros so //
analyzed: bu ram la bzlas te bza' bar byin na mi 'bros so //
translated: one should recite the mantra over molasses and give it to them to eat. They will not flee.

original: grong bstan par bya ba'i sbyor ba gzhan yang rdza mkhan gyi lag pa phyis pa'i 'jim pa la snod byas la stong rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas te /
analyzed: grong bstan par bya ba'i sbyor ba gzhan yang rdza mkhan gyi lag pa phyis pa'i 'jim pa la snod byas la stong rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas te /
translated: Another rite for the destruction of a village: Having made a pot out of clay from a potter’s workshop, incant it one thousand and eight times.

original: dbugs mi 'byin par chu'i nang du bzhag na brtan par 'gyur ro //🔽ci ste dgra gsad par 'dod na spra tshil lam /
analyzed: dbugs mi 'byin par chu'i nang du bzhag na brtan par 'gyur ro // ci ste dgra gsad par 'dod na spra tshil lam /
translated: If one places it in water without exhaling, it will become stable.🔽If one wishes to kill an enemy, make a likeness out of beeswax

original: bag zan las gzugs brnyan byas la /
analyzed: bag zan las gzugs brnyan byas la /
translated: or dough.

original: chos gos kyi ras kyis gzugs brnyan gyi gdong nas brtsams te rkang pa'i mthar thug par dkris la legs par spas te /
analyzed: chos gos kyi ras kyis gzugs brnyan gyi gdong nas brtsams te rkang pa'i mthar thug par dkris la legs par spas te /
translated: Wrap the face of the likeness with a piece of cloth from one’s lower robe, starting from the face and ending at the feet.🔽Place one’s hand on top of it and recite the mantra of the name-recitation one thousand times.

original: de'i steng du lag pa bzhag la ming dang spel pa'i sngags stong du gcig gis ma tshang ba bzlas nas lha mchod pa'i khyim gyi phyogs gcig tu bzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du lag pa bzhag la ming dang spel pa'i sngags stong du gcig gis ma tshang ba bzlas nas lha mchod pa'i khyim gyi phyogs gcig tu bzhag ste /
translated: Place it in one corner of the house where the deity is worshipped, and nail it in the heart with a thorn of neem wood.

original: snying gar seng ldeng gi phur bu'i btab la phur bu'i steng du dus gsum du chu tshan blugs shing yongs su bzlas na brlag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying gar seng ldeng gi phur bu'i btab la phur bu'i steng du dus gsum du chu tshan blugs shing yongs su bzlas na brlag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one pours hot water on the thorn and recites the mantra three times, it will be destroyed.

original: nyi shu'i phyed kyi rdzas dang / kha cher sbyar la rnal 'byor pas thig le byas na skye bo skal ba bzang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi shu'i phyed kyi rdzas dang / kha cher sbyar la rnal 'byor pas thig le byas na skye bo skal ba bzang por 'gyur ro //
translated: If the yogin makes a bindu with half of the twenty substances and the great lac, he will become a person of good fortune.

original: rdzas de dag ma la ya skyes dang bcas pas yan lag thams cad byugs te gang la reg pa de shi yang mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: rdzas de dag ma la ya skyes dang bcas pas yan lag thams cad byugs te gang la reg pa de shi yang mi gtong ngo //
translated: If one anoints all the limbs with those substances together with the one born in Malaya, one will not be released from whomever one touches.

original: rdzas de dag nyid dmar po dang / ba la sha dang / sbrang rtsi dang / nad kyi dbang po dang / 'tshod byed dang / lhan cig tu @348b bsres te byas na rtag tu sa steng ba rnams byams shing thams cad du rgyal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdzas de dag nyid dmar po dang / ba la sha dang / sbrang rtsi dang / nad kyi dbang po dang / 'tshod byed dang / lhan cig tu @348b bsres te byas na rtag tu sa steng ba rnams byams shing thams cad du rgyal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one mixes those very substances with red lac, balaśa, honey, śirīṣa, and turmeric, and makes [a paste], one will always be loved by all people on the surface of the earth and will be victorious everywhere.

original: rgyal po dang / rgyal po'i blon po rnams kyis rnal 'byor pa thams cad du srung bar 'gyur ba la the tshom med do //
analyzed: rgyal po dang / rgyal po'i blon po rnams kyis rnal 'byor pa thams cad du srung bar 'gyur ba la the tshom med do //
translated: There is no doubt that the yogin will be protected everywhere by kings and royal ministers.

original: rtsa sngags 'bum du bzlas nas su //
analyzed: rtsa sngags 'bum du bzlas nas su //
translated: Having recited the root mantra one hundred thousand times,

original: de 'og las rnams brtsam par bya //
analyzed: de 'og las rnams brtsam par bya //
translated: one should then commence the activities.🔽Otherwise, one will die an untimely death

original: gzhan du dus min 'chi ba dang // dmyal bar nges par sreg 'gyur zhes //
analyzed: gzhan du dus min 'chi ba dang // dmyal bar nges par sreg 'gyur zhes //
translated: and will certainly be burned in hell.

original: mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
translated: And is united with all the dakinis.🔽

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog /
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog /
translated: The Vajra Dakini, the supreme bliss of union with all dakinis,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
translated: Vajrasattva, the Tathagata,

original: bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs //
analyzed: bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs //
translated: was taught by the Blessed One, the Vajra Holder.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro las /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro las /
translated: From the great king of tantras, the glorious Vajradaka,

original: las thams cad kyi tshogs rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i cho ga rgyas pa'i rim par phye ba ste bzhi pa'o ////
analyzed: las thams cad kyi tshogs rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i cho ga rgyas pa'i rim par phye ba ste bzhi pa'o ////
translated: the fourth chapter of the extensive ritual procedure called the “Arising of the Assembly of All Activities” is complete.

original: de nas mkha' dbyings dbus gyur par //
analyzed: de nas mkha' dbyings dbus gyur par //
translated: Then, in the middle of the sky,

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsam bya ba //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsam bya ba //
translated: one should visualize a sun maṇḍala.

original: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams nam mkha' la //
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams nam mkha' la //
translated: In the directions and the intermediate directions in the sky,

original: dpag med rigs kyis yongs gang ba'o //
analyzed: dpag med rigs kyis yongs gang ba'o //
translated: it is completely filled with the immeasurable family.

original: mkha' dbyings nyi ma de dbus su //
analyzed: mkha' dbyings nyi ma de dbus su //
translated: In the middle of that sun in the sky,

original: rang gi sa bon mtshan ma ni //🔽nyi ma stong bas lhag pa yi //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon mtshan ma ni // nyi ma stong bas lhag pa yi //
translated: one’s own seed syllable and sign🔽blaze with sharp light rays

original: 'od zer rnon po 'bar zhig 'khrug /
analyzed: 'od zer rnon po 'bar zhig 'khrug /
translated: that surpass a thousand suns.

original: me stag 'phro bas bdud sde bsreg /🔽gong bur de bsdus sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: me stag 'phro bas bdud sde bsreg / gong bur de bsdus sbyor ba yis //
translated: The demons’ armies are burned by the sparks that fly off.🔽The mass is gathered into a whole by the yoga,

original: zhu ba las ni skur bzhengs pa //
analyzed: zhu ba las ni skur bzhengs pa //
translated: and from the melting, the form arises.

original: sku mdog sngon po drag chen po //
analyzed: sku mdog sngon po drag chen po //
translated: His body is blue, very wrathful,

original: 'od zer bskal pa'i me dang mtshungs //
analyzed: 'od zer bskal pa'i me dang mtshungs //
translated: His light rays are like the fire at the end of the eon.

original: 'bar ba'i lus dang skra chen gyis //
analyzed: 'bar ba'i lus dang skra chen gyis //
translated: With a blazing body and great hair,

original: 'jigs pa @349a *//
analyzed: 'jigs pa @349a *//
translated: He terrifies

original: dag kyang 'jigs par mdzad //
analyzed: dag kyang 'jigs par mdzad //
translated: Even the terrifying.

original: lhag ger bzhad chen tshem gyi 'od //🔽lha mo'i dkyil 'khor rgyun chags kyi //
analyzed: lhag ger bzhad chen tshem gyi 'od // lha mo'i dkyil 'khor rgyun chags kyi //
translated: With the light of a great, brilliant smile,🔽He abides at the end of the net

original: 'khor lo bla re mthar gnas shing //
analyzed: 'khor lo bla re mthar gnas shing //
translated: Of the circle of goddesses.

original: slar yang 'od ldan phyag bzhi bzhi //
analyzed: slar yang 'od ldan phyag bzhi bzhi //
translated: Again, he has four light rays and four arms,

original: thod ka sgyu ma chen mos mdzes //
analyzed: thod ka sgyu ma chen mos mdzes //
translated: Adorned with a skull and great magic.

original: rgyal ba rnam grol dri med rgyun /
analyzed: rgyal ba rnam grol dri med rgyun /
translated: The victor, the stream of stainless liberation,

original: kha ba mchog gi gzer tshogs 'khru //
analyzed: kha ba mchog gi gzer tshogs 'khru //
translated: Is purified by the assembly of the best of snow mountains.

original: nyis 'gyur du ni byung bas gsal //
analyzed: nyis 'gyur du ni byung bas gsal //
translated: It is clear, arising in pairs.

original: rin chen la bzhugs zhabs gnyis bskyod //
analyzed: rin chen la bzhugs zhabs gnyis bskyod //
translated: Seated on a jewel, he moves his two feet,🔽Beautifully moving to the end

original: grong khyer sum brtsegs la sogs pa'i //🔽mthar thug bskyod pas rab mdzes pa //🔽rnam par rgyal ba'i rgyun 'jug cing //
analyzed: grong khyer sum brtsegs la sogs pa'i // mthar thug bskyod pas rab mdzes pa // rnam par rgyal ba'i rgyun 'jug cing //
translated: Of the triple-stacked city, and so forth.🔽The stream of victory enters,

original: 'byung 'jug dbugs ni yongs gang ba'i //
analyzed: 'byung 'jug dbugs ni yongs gang ba'i //
translated: Completely filling the exhaled and inhaled breath.

original: skra yi tshogs kyis 'joms byed pa //
analyzed: skra yi tshogs kyis 'joms byed pa //
translated: The assembly of hair destroys

original: sa gsum po ni rab tu g-yo //
analyzed: sa gsum po ni rab tu g-yo //
translated: The shaking of the three worlds.

original: mtshon cha sna tshogs 'phangs pas khyab //
analyzed: mtshon cha sna tshogs 'phangs pas khyab //
translated: Various weapons are thrown, pervading everywhere.

original: mun pa'i tshogs kyis gtibs pa bzhin //
analyzed: mun pa'i tshogs kyis gtibs pa bzhin //
translated: Like being covered by a mass of darkness,

original: thams cad du ni 'jigs par mdzad //
analyzed: thams cad du ni 'jigs par mdzad //
translated: everywhere is made terrifying.🔽Even the gods residing in the sky,

original: gnam la gnas pa'i lha rnams dang // 'byung po'i bdag po tshangs sogs kyang //🔽rkang pa'i grib ma'i mtha' tsam yang //
analyzed: gnam la gnas pa'i lha rnams dang // 'byung po'i bdag po tshangs sogs kyang // rkang pa'i grib ma'i mtha' tsam yang //
translated: the lords of spirits, Brahma and so forth,🔽are not able to bear

original: nye bar bzod par nus ma yin //
analyzed: nye bar bzod par nus ma yin //
translated: even the edge of the shadow of his feet.🔽Other deceptive hosts of obstacles,

original: bgegs kyi tshogs gzhan sgyu can dang // srin po la sogs lha gzhan gyis //🔽'od kyi dkyil 'khor phyi rol gyi //
analyzed: bgegs kyi tshogs gzhan sgyu can dang // srin po la sogs lha gzhan gyis // 'od kyi dkyil 'khor phyi rol gyi //
translated: rakshasas and other gods,🔽even at the outer

original: dpag tshad 'bum gyi mthar yang ni //
analyzed: dpag tshad 'bum gyi mthar yang ni //
translated: limit of a hundred thousand yojanas from the orb of light,🔽are not able to bear

original: nye bar bzod par nus ma yin //
analyzed: nye bar bzod par nus ma yin //
translated: It is not possible to endure them.🔽

original: yod med de ni lha yi phyogs //
analyzed: yod med de ni lha yi phyogs //
translated: That existence and non-existence is the direction of the gods.

original: cung zad 'od kyi lus can yang //
analyzed: cung zad 'od kyi lus can yang //
translated: Even those with slightly luminous bodies,

original: rdul lam du ba lta @349b bur g-yo //🔽padma r'a ga lta bu yi //
analyzed: rdul lam du ba lta @349b bur g-yo // padma r'a ga lta bu yi //
translated: moving like dust or smoke,🔽with a left face like a ruby,

original: g-yon zhal 'od zer tshogs kyis ni //
analyzed: g-yon zhal 'od zer tshogs kyis ni //
translated: with a mass of light rays,

original: thams cad ma lus sreg snyam sems //🔽bandu ka yi me tog gi /
analyzed: thams cad ma lus sreg snyam sems // bandu ka yi me tog gi /
translated: think of burning everything without exception.

original: phung po spungs 'dra'i 'od kyis ni //
analyzed: phung po spungs 'dra'i 'od kyis ni //
translated: With light like a heap of bandhuka flowers,

original: rigs gsum las byung kun nas ni //
analyzed: rigs gsum las byung kun nas ni //
translated: And the three families,

original: lhag pa thams cad ngo mtshar gyur //
analyzed: lhag pa thams cad ngo mtshar gyur //
translated: All the others were amazed.

original: 'od gzugs des ni sreg snyam sems //
analyzed: 'od gzugs des ni sreg snyam sems //
translated: They thought, “He will be burned by that light.”

original: nyi ma stong bas lhag 'od kyis //
analyzed: nyi ma stong bas lhag 'od kyis //
translated: With light surpassing a thousand suns,🔽He was inspired and attained enlightenment.

original: bskul zhing byang chub thob par mdzad; ;phat sgra chen pos sad mdzad cing //
analyzed: bskul zhing byang chub thob par mdzad; ;phat sgra chen pos sad mdzad cing //
translated: With a great sound of “Phaṭ,” he awakened,

original: rab tu bsgyings pas lha kun bsreg /
analyzed: rab tu bsgyings pas lha kun bsreg /
translated: And with his great pride, he burned all the gods.

original: g-yas zhal dkar po'i 'od zer ni //
analyzed: g-yas zhal dkar po'i 'od zer ni //
translated: The light rays from the white right face🔽Are like a heap of snow essence,🔽Crystal, beryl,

original: gangs kyi snying po spungs pa dang // shel dang bee d'ur rdo dang ni; ;ngang pa kunda zla 'dra ba'i //
analyzed: gangs kyi snying po spungs pa dang // shel dang bee d'ur rdo dang ni; ;ngang pa kunda zla 'dra ba'i //
translated: And geese, jasmine, and the moon.

original: dri med 'od kyis gsal mdzad pa //
analyzed: dri med 'od kyis gsal mdzad pa //
translated: They illuminate with stainless light.

original: rnyog pa med pa'i gdengs ka'i bar //
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa'i gdengs ka'i bar //
translated: Without turbidity, they extend

original: rang gi chu rgyun 'bab pa bzhin //
analyzed: rang gi chu rgyun 'bab pa bzhin //
translated: Like the flow of one’s own water.

original: rgyal ba'i rigs kun gsal bar mdzad //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i rigs kun gsal bar mdzad //
translated: They illuminate all the families of the Victorious Ones.

original: nub ni ser po gser btsos 'dra //
analyzed: nub ni ser po gser btsos 'dra //
translated: The western face is yellow like refined gold,🔽Like the kusuma ja flower,

original: ku sum dza yi me tog dang // me 'bar sol ba spungs 'dra zhing //🔽nyi ma 'char ka'i 'od 'dra ba'i //
analyzed: ku sum dza yi me tog dang // me 'bar sol ba spungs 'dra zhing // nyi ma 'char ka'i 'od 'dra ba'i //
translated: And like a heap of burning embers.🔽With sidelong glances like the light of the rising sun,

original: spyan zur bgrad pas 'jigs par mdzad //
analyzed: spyan zur bgrad pas 'jigs par mdzad //
translated: He is terrifying.

original: shin tu drag pa'i gzugs chen las //
analyzed: shin tu drag pa'i gzugs chen las //
translated: From the very fierce great form,

original: sa gzhi rnams ni ma lus par //
analyzed: sa gzhi rnams ni ma lus par //
translated: the entire surface of the earth

original: skar mda'i 'od ltar lding zhing 'khrug /
analyzed: skar mda'i 'od ltar lding zhing 'khrug /
translated: is agitated, shaking like the light of a shooting star.

original: blta bar dka' zhing gzung bar dka'//
analyzed: blta bar dka' zhing gzung bar dka'//
translated: Difficult to look at, difficult to grasp,

original: me lce 'khyil ba lta bur 'bar //
analyzed: me lce 'khyil ba lta bur 'bar //
translated: blazing like a whirling firebrand,

original: dpag tshad stong phrag du ma ru //🔽yangs pa'i rdo rje mda' yi ni //
analyzed: dpag tshad stong phrag du ma ru // yangs pa'i rdo rje mda' yi ni //
translated: for many thousands of yojanas🔽the great net of the vast vajra arrow

original: dra ba chen pos 'khor lo bcings //🔽khva gdong la sogs so so yi //
analyzed: dra ba chen pos 'khor lo bcings // khva gdong la sogs so so yi //
translated: binds the wheel.

original: ba spu re re'i khung @350a *//
analyzed: ba spu re re'i khung @350a *//
translated: From each pore of the individual🔽Kākāsyā and so forth,

original: nas kyang // ri rab du ma'i rdul mtshungs pa'i //
analyzed: nas kyang // ri rab du ma'i rdul mtshungs pa'i //
translated: equal to the atoms of many Mount Merus,

original: mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor lo dang // rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin rnams //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor lo dang // rdo rje gsum gyi rang bzhin rnams //
translated: the wheels of ḍākinīs and the three vajras

original: spro bas nam mkha' gsal mdzad pa //
analyzed: spro bas nam mkha' gsal mdzad pa //
translated: radiate and illuminate the sky.

original: phyag brgyad spyan gsum gyen skra 'bar //
analyzed: phyag brgyad spyan gsum gyen skra 'bar //
translated: With three eyes, blazing upward hair,

original: mkha' 'gro nyi shu bzhi phyed bskor //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro nyi shu bzhi phyed bskor //
translated: surrounded by twenty-four ḍākinīs,

original: de ltar sngags pas rnam bsam bya //
analyzed: de ltar sngags pas rnam bsam bya //
translated: the mantrin should visualize it in this way.

original: g-yas dang pho na rdo rje sngon po 'bar zhing rno ba gdengs pa la rigs ldan gyis dkris pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas dang pho na rdo rje sngon po 'bar zhing rno ba gdengs pa la rigs ldan gyis dkris pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the right [hands] are a blazing blue vajra, sharp and extended, wrapped with a serpent.

original: gnyis pa na padmas bcings pa'i mda' mchog go /
analyzed: gnyis pa na padmas bcings pa'i mda' mchog go /
translated: In the second [hand] is an excellent arrow bound with a lotus.

original: gsum pa na padma chen pos yub dkris pa'i ral gri'o //
analyzed: gsum pa na padma chen pos yub dkris pa'i ral gri'o //
translated: In the third [hand] is a sword wrapped in a great lotus.

original: bzhi pa na dung skyong gi zhags pas dkris pa'i lcags kyu'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa na dung skyong gi zhags pas dkris pa'i lcags kyu'o //
translated: In the fourth [hand] is a hook wrapped with the noose of Vāsuki.

original: g-yon gyi dang po na mtha' yas kyi ba dan btags pa'i kha tv'am ga bsgreng pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon gyi dang po na mtha' yas kyi ba dan btags pa'i kha tv'am ga bsgreng pa'o //
translated: In the first left [hand] is a raised khaṭvāṅga marked with a banner of Ananta.

original: gnyis pa na nor rgyas kyi bu yis rgyud byas pa'i gzhu'i mchog go /
analyzed: gnyis pa na nor rgyas kyi bu yis rgyud byas pa'i gzhu'i mchog go /
translated: In the second [hand] is an excellent bow strung with Airāvata.

original: gsum pa na 'jog po'i zhags pa dang sdigs mdzub bo //
analyzed: gsum pa na 'jog po'i zhags pa dang sdigs mdzub bo //
translated: In the third [hand] is a noose of Varuṇa and a threatening gesture.

original: bzhi pa na tshangs pa'i mgo khrag 'dzag pa stobs kyi rgyus bcings pa bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa na tshangs pa'i mgo khrag 'dzag pa stobs kyi rgyus bcings pa bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the fourth [hand] is a dripping blood-filled skull of Brahmā bound with a garland of rudrāksa.

original: klu'i rgyal po de dag thams cad kyang mche ba gtsigs shing lce 'dril ba /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po de dag thams cad kyang mche ba gtsigs shing lce 'dril ba /
translated: All of those nāga kings have bared fangs, curled tongues,

original: blta ba'i dug can /
analyzed: blta ba'i dug can /
translated: and poisonous eyes.

original: gdengs ka'i nor bu'i 'od kyis nam mkha'i ngos thams cad gsal ba'o //
analyzed: gdengs ka'i nor bu'i 'od kyis nam mkha'i ngos thams cad gsal ba'o //
translated: The light of the jewel on his hood illuminates all the directions.

original: khva gdong ma la sogs pa thams cad kyang sprul gyi rgyan gyis klubs shing spyan gsum pa /
analyzed: khva gdong ma la sogs pa thams cad kyang sprul gyi rgyan gyis klubs shing spyan gsum pa /
translated: All of them, such as Kākāsyā, are adorned with snake ornaments and have three eyes.

original: skra gyen du 'bar ba /🔽phyag na brangs gri dang / kha tv'am ga dang / thod pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: skra gyen du 'bar ba / phyag na brangs gri dang / kha tv'am ga dang / thod pa bsnams pa /
translated: Their hair blazes upward.🔽They hold in their hands a knife, a khaṭvāṅga, and a skull cup.

original: thod pa'i phreng bas klubs @350b shing gcer bu zhal mche ba gtsigs pa /
analyzed: thod pa'i phreng bas klubs @350b shing gcer bu zhal mche ba gtsigs pa /
translated: They are adorned with a garland of skulls, are naked, and have bared fangs.

original: 'od zer sna tshogs 'phro ba /
analyzed: 'od zer sna tshogs 'phro ba /
translated: They radiate various light rays.

original: khro gnyer gyi rim pa can /
analyzed: khro gnyer gyi rim pa can /
translated: They have a frown.

original: zur mig tu gzigs pas sa gzhi bskyod cing /
analyzed: zur mig tu gzigs pas sa gzhi bskyod cing /
translated: They look askance, shaking the ground.

original: klu'i tshogs skrag pas kha sbub tu 'gyel bar bsam na /
analyzed: klu'i tshogs skrag pas kha sbub tu 'gyel bar bsam na /
translated: The hosts of nāgas fall face down, terrified.

original: nam mkha' la gnas te /
analyzed: nam mkha' la gnas te /
translated: They are in the sky.

original: char gyi rgyun gtong bas sa gzhi skad cig gis gang bar byed do //🔽zhes; mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
analyzed: char gyi rgyun gtong bas sa gzhi skad cig gis gang bar byed do // zhes; mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
translated: They cause a rain to fall, filling the ground in an instant.🔽The supreme blazing ḍākinī

original: mkha' 'gro ma ni 'bar ba'i mchog /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma ni 'bar ba'i mchog /
translated: is united with all the ḍākinīs.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
translated: Vajrasattva, the tathāgata,

original: bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs //
analyzed: bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs //
translated: The Blessed One, the Vajra Holder, has taught

original: yang na rta bla mo zhib tu btags la ras kyis g-yogs te li khri dang bsres la sbrang rtsis sprus te mgo bdun pa'i klu'i gzugs sor bcu gnyis pa byas la /
analyzed: yang na rta bla mo zhib tu btags la ras kyis g-yogs te li khri dang bsres la sbrang rtsis sprus te mgo bdun pa'i klu'i gzugs sor bcu gnyis pa byas la /
translated: Alternatively, one should grind the dung of a horse or an ox, mix it with red chalk, knead it with honey, and make a twelve-finger-breadth image of a seven-headed nāga.

original: de'i khang pa sor bcu drug yangs par byas nas /
analyzed: de'i khang pa sor bcu drug yangs par byas nas /
translated: Make its house sixteen finger-breadths wide.🔽Make that house square with four faces.

original: khang pa de gru bzhi la gdong bzhi byas te; gru gcig pa ni /
analyzed: khang pa de gru bzhi la gdong bzhi byas te; gru gcig pa ni /
translated: On one side,

original: rta'i gdong pa /
analyzed: rta'i gdong pa /
translated: make the face of a horse.

original: gnyis pa la seng ge'i gdong pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa la seng ge'i gdong pa /
translated: On the second, make the face of a lion.

original: gsum pa la spre'u'i gdong pa /
analyzed: gsum pa la spre'u'i gdong pa /
translated: On the third, make the face of a monkey.

original: bzhi pa la nya'i gdong ba byas te /
analyzed: bzhi pa la nya'i gdong ba byas te /
translated: On the fourth, make the face of a fish.

original: de'i nang du klu'i rgyal po ras kha dog sna tshogs pas g-yogs te bzhag la /
analyzed: de'i nang du klu'i rgyal po ras kha dog sna tshogs pas g-yogs te bzhag la /
translated: Inside that, place the king of nāgas, covered with cloth of various colors.

original: de nas sngags brgya rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas pas btab ste /
analyzed: de nas sngags brgya rtsa brgyad yongs su bzlas pas btab ste /
translated: Then, having consecrated it with the mantra completely recited one hundred and eight times,

original: yid kyis ji ltar 'dod pa'i me tog dang / bdug pa dang / gtor ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa bsam ste byin la /
analyzed: yid kyis ji ltar 'dod pa'i me tog dang / bdug pa dang / gtor ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa bsam ste byin la /
translated: mentally imagine and offer whatever desired offerings of flowers, incense, bali, and so forth.

original: yungs kar la lan bdun sngags te klu'i steng du gtor te /
analyzed: yungs kar la lan bdun sngags te klu'i steng du gtor te /
translated: Enchant mustard seeds seven times and scatter them over the nāgas.

original: de nas 'dod pa thams cad pa'i gtor ma byin na /
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa thams cad pa'i gtor ma byin na /
translated: Then, if you give a bali offering of all that is desired,

original: des klu'i rgyal po rnams mdza' bor @351a *//
analyzed: des klu'i rgyal po rnams mdza' bor @351a *//
translated: the nāga kings will become friendly.

original: gyur nas klu thams cad kyis than pa byung ba'i dus su nyi ma bdun char phab pas 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad gang bar byed do //
analyzed: gyur nas klu thams cad kyis than pa byung ba'i dus su nyi ma bdun char phab pas 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad gang bar byed do //
translated: All the nāgas will cause rain to fall for seven days when there is a drought, and the entire world will be filled.

original: char mi 'bab pa'i dus su de ltar byas na gdon mi bra  bar char 'bab bo //
analyzed: char mi 'bab pa'i dus su de ltar byas na gdon mi bra  bar char 'bab bo //
translated: If you do this when there is no rain, it will certainly rain.

original: ci ste klu gdug pa can yin na yang rlung grang mo dang / rdo char dang / klog dang / ser ba 'bebs te /
analyzed: ci ste klu gdug pa can yin na yang rlung grang mo dang / rdo char dang / klog dang / ser ba 'bebs te /
translated: Even if the nāgas are malicious, they will cause a cold wind, hail, thunder, and lightning.

original: de bzlog par 'dod na rig pa 'dzin pas thal ba dang / yungs kar zho gnyis tsam la lan nyi shu'i bar du bzlas te /
analyzed: de bzlog par 'dod na rig pa 'dzin pas thal ba dang / yungs kar zho gnyis tsam la lan nyi shu'i bar du bzlas te /
translated: If you wish to avert that, the knowledge-holder should enchant two handfuls of ashes and mustard seeds twenty times.

original: ji srid 'dod pa'i sa phyogs su mtshams bcings la /
analyzed: ji srid 'dod pa'i sa phyogs su mtshams bcings la /
translated: As long as you wish, bind the area.

original: yang de nyid la lan bdun bzlas te /
analyzed: yang de nyid la lan bdun bzlas te /
translated: Again, enchant it seven times.

original: klu'i mgor bsnun zhing yid kyis ji snyed 'dod par phyogs bcing ba byas te /
analyzed: klu'i mgor bsnun zhing yid kyis ji snyed 'dod par phyogs bcing ba byas te /
translated: Having struck the nāga's head, one should bind the directions as much as one desires mentally.

original: phyogs mtshams dang steng 'og tu gtor na mtshams chen po bcings par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs mtshams dang steng 'og tu gtor na mtshams chen po bcings par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one scatters [the ashes] in the cardinal and intermediate directions, above and below, one will bind a great boundary.

original: ji ste dgra thams cad dang / 'gran zla dang / sdang ba'i grogs po dang / sdang ba'i phyogs byed pa rnams dang / pha rol gyi 'khor lo 'jigs shing gdul bar 'dod pa dang / btags pa dang / bcing ba dang / gsad pa dang /
analyzed: ji ste dgra thams cad dang / 'gran zla dang / sdang ba'i grogs po dang / sdang ba'i phyogs byed pa rnams dang / pha rol gyi 'khor lo 'jigs shing gdul bar 'dod pa dang / btags pa dang / bcing ba dang / gsad pa dang /
translated: If one wishes to frighten and subdue all enemies, rivals, hostile friends, hostile factions, and the armies of adversaries, to bind, kill,

original: rengs pa dang / gzhom par 'dod na /
analyzed: rengs pa dang / gzhom par 'dod na /
translated: paralyze, and destroy them,

original: rta bla mo de nyid dur khrod kyi thal ba dang bsgos te /
analyzed: rta bla mo de nyid dur khrod kyi thal ba dang bsgos te /
translated: one should color that very clay with charnel ground ash.

original: skyes pa'am / bud med kyi gzugs byas la /
analyzed: skyes pa'am / bud med kyi gzugs byas la /
translated: One should make the form of a man or a woman,

original: khro bo chen po'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te /
analyzed: khro bo chen po'i sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te /
translated: enchant it one hundred and eight times with the mantra of the Great Wrathful One,

original: dur khrod kyis brkos pa'i nang du ming nas smos te bzhag la /
analyzed: dur khrod kyis brkos pa'i nang du ming nas smos te bzhag la /
translated: and place it in a pit dug in a charnel ground, naming [the victim].

original: yungs kar la brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te de'i steng du gtor la /
analyzed: yungs kar la brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te de'i steng du gtor la /
translated: One should scatter white mustard seeds enchanted one hundred and eight times over it.

original: seng ldeng gi @351b phur bu la lan brgyad bzlas te btab nas sbas na /
analyzed: seng ldeng gi @351b phur bu la lan brgyad bzlas te btab nas sbas na /
translated: Having enchanted a kīla of acacia wood eight times, bury it.

original: ji srid phur bu ma bton gyi bar du sdug bsngal chen po nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji srid phur bu ma bton gyi bar du sdug bsngal chen po nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: As long as the kīla is not extracted, he will experience great suffering.

original: rig pa 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis dgrol bar mi nus so //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis dgrol bar mi nus so //
translated: He cannot be freed by anyone other than a knowledge-holder.

original: ci ste gsad par 'dod na mi rus kyi phur bu la sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pas bsnun la /
analyzed: ci ste gsad par 'dod na mi rus kyi phur bu la sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas pas bsnun la /
translated: If you wish to kill him, strike with a kīla of human bone enchanted 108 times.

original: khrag dang bcas pa'i yungs kar la bzlas te gtor na zhag bdun sdod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khrag dang bcas pa'i yungs kar la bzlas te gtor na zhag bdun sdod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Enchanted mustard seeds mixed with blood, if cast, he will not live for seven days.

original: zhes; mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
analyzed: zhes; mkha' 'gro kun dang mnyam sbyor ba'i //
translated: Thus it is said in the Union with All Dakinis,

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog /
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog /
translated: The Vajra Dakini Supreme Bliss,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs //
translated: Vajrasattva, the Tathagata,

original: bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs //
analyzed: bcom ldan rdo rje can gyis gsungs //
translated: The Blessed One, the Vajra Holder.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro las /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro las /
translated: From the great king of tantras, the glorious Vajradaka,

original: klu thams cad dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba'i chog rgyas pa ste rim par phye ba lnga pa'o ////
analyzed: klu thams cad dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba'i chog rgyas pa ste rim par phye ba lnga pa'o ////
translated: The extensive ritual for summoning all nāgas, for making them enter, and for binding them.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha mo rnams kyis slar yang mchod cing phyag byas te 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha mo rnams kyis slar yang mchod cing phyag byas te 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the goddesses again made offerings to the Blessed One, bowed down, and said this:
